Description: One day, this will be your nation's flag. [Equip to an Auxiliary slot.]
Name: A Banner of Coming Glory

Description: A boxful of mystery. Open it!
Name: A Cache of Curiosities

Description: It was the Laconic General who named the Carnelian Coast. Then she discovered it was full of sapphires. Imagine her embarrassment.
Name: A Casket of Sapphires

Description: This dreamy, furtive fellow is travelling to the Principles of Coral.
Name: A Chequered Character

Description: There is much still to discover here. But this will suffice for now.
Name: A Comprehensive Port Report: Empire of Hands

Description: An invitation to meet the Delightful Adventuress at the University. (This continues the Empire of Hands story)
Name: A Delightful Invitation

Description: Take it to the Empire of Hands for a reward
Name: A Delivery of Hydrogen

Description: You have professional, perhaps even qualified, medical assistance.
Name: A Doctor Aboard

Description: This is a chapter of the Crimson Book, that notorious compilation of love stories long-sought by the Masters of the Bazaar.
Name: A Dream of Red

Description: Highly profitable, if you have no principles. [This stuff is too dangerous even to be properly illegal. Be cautious in taking it to London.]
Name: A Firkin of Red Honey

Description: Suspended in what feels like a chip of zee-salt. The Exquisite Seneschal of the Empire of Hands claims it will be useful.
Name: A Frozen Drop of Red Honey
A Gift for the Monkey Emperor

Description: Fresh from the Surface, only a little bruised.
Name: A Gift for the Pirate-King

Description: It is beautifully enamelled. Its eyes glisten like digestive fluid.
Name: A Gift for the Wistful Deviless

Description: A sign of the trust of the Pirate-King of the Isle of Cats.
Name: A Key to the Cage-Gardens

Description: He wouldn't be painted without his hat.
Name: A Locket with a Dapper Chap's Portrait

Description: She never quite smiles.
Name: A Locket with a Likely Lass' Portrait

Description: One zailor's treasure is another zailor's junk. But this looks interesting...
Name: A Long-Buried Treasure

Description: It blazes with apocyanic radiance. Wars have been fought for less. [You may find a use for this: or the Alarming Scholar will certainly purchase it.]
Name: A Lump of Blue Scintillack

Description: Not miracles, really. But they'll never get close enough to see the difference.
Name: A Manual of Miracles

Description: Unsealed, but written in one of the more esoteric scripts of Hell.
Name: A Message from the Wistful Deviless

Description: A sullen viric glow leaks from within. Sometimes it rattles. Best not open it.
Name: A Mirrorcatch Box Full of Very Angry Dream-Snakes

Description: Dream-greeh snake-skin and scraps of close-written paper
Name: A Mirror-Charm

Description: You've welcomed a stranger aboard your ship. This may lead to complications.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Consequences wait.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Welcome aboard, stranger.~0|A certain matter has become clear.
Name: A New Face

Description: "A wakes APOCYAN, the blue of memory and brightest coral."
Name: A Page from 'The Neathbow': Apocyan

Description: "C lights COSMOGONE, the colour of remembered suns. The fecund, the foetid, the fungal: these flourish in the glow of cosmogone."
Name: A Page from 'The Neathbow': Cosmogone

Description: "G is lost in GANT, which remains when all other colours are eaten. Gant can be found where shadows are myriad."
Name: A Page from 'The Neathbow': Gant

Description: "I is for IRRIGO. No one remembers why. Irrigo colours the forgotten corners of home."
Name: A Page from 'The Neathbow': Irrigo

Description: "P drowns in PELIGIN, the colour of the deepest zee. [Someone has scrawled in the margin: BEYOND THE GATE THERE IS A SEA MORE SUNLESS]"
Name: A Page from 'The Neathbow': Peligin

Description: "V marks VIOLANT when blood is shed in a spired place. Violant ink is employed for the most desperate treaties..."
Name: A Page from 'The Neathbow': Violant

Description: "Behind your mirror, V names VIRIC, the colour of shallow sleep."
Name: A Page from 'The Neathbow': Viric

Description: Something inexplicable from Irem. Will it really protect against sunlight?
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Before now, you didn't have the Parabox.~0|Before now, you had the Parabox.
Name: A Parabox

Description: Provided by the Exquisite Seneschal to kill the Cannibal Pirates plaguing the Empire of Hands.
Name: A Particularly Potent Poison

Description: The way to the Surface, and a marvel of engineering. The Admiralty has a very modest interest.
Name: A Perfunctory Port Report: the Cumaean Canal

Description:
A study of a clearing amid trees that do not grow in the Neath, of a zee-captain smashing the image of a painted serpent. The zee-captain's crew look on calmly. A forked tongue is visible in one's open mouth. The painting is tinted everywhere with viric - the greenish colour of shallow sleep, which cannot be seen on the surface of the world.
You are the zee-captain in the painting; you are also the painter.
Name: A Phantasmal Encounter, 189-, Captain ------

Description: The nuns endure.
Name: A Port Report: Abbey Rock

Description: Gateway to the Elder Continent! Devourer of the naive.
Name: A Port Report: Adam's Way

Description: The light dazzles and burns. Few can tolerate its strength.
Name: A Port Report: Aestival

Description: You have seen where the world ends. Behind those peaks of ice, something colder by far.
Name: A Port Report: Avid Horizon

Description: The exiles do not speak, and the monkeys merely chatter grumpily. Still, there is information to be gleaned here.
Name: A Port Report: Codex

Description: Recent events out on the edge of London's interests.
Name: A Port Report: Demeaux Island

Description: The latest news from the island of soul-stealing apes. Technically, monkeys.
Name: A Port Report: Empire of Hands

Description: Yezz. Yezz. We know zzo much. We are home.
Name: A Port Report: Fallen London

Description: Pristine towers of zee ice. An encampment of questions and riddles.
Name: A Port Report: Frostfound

Description: The Admiralty, among others, is always interested in pirate business.
Name: A Port Report: Gaider's Mourn

Description: A fallen stalactite: a monastery filled with plunder.
Name: A Port Report: Godfall

Description: Efficient workers sing vigorously. Keen eyes observe.
Name: A Port Report: Grand Geode

Description: An odd place. Best to keep an eye on it.
Name: A Port Report: Hunter's Keep

Description: You will have been there.
Name: A Port Report: Irem

Description: A dissolute smugglers' haven of alehouses and honey-dens
Name: A Port Report: Isle of Cats

Description: The lights are gone from the Keep.
Name: A Port Report: Keep's End

Description: Bright, dark, fierce, soft, rich, desperate. A complicated place: like London.
Name: A Port Report: Khan's Heart

Description: Long-moored ships provide shelter for exiles.
Name: A Port Report: Khan's Shadow

Description: This is the place the world ends.
Name: A Port Report: Kingeater's Castle

Description: A detailed report on a place of interest. The Admiralty would value it.
Name: A Port Report: Mt Palmerston

Description: The statue's hard to miss.
Name: A Port Report: Nuncio

Description: Two houses, both alike in dignity. Which isn't saying much.
Name: A Port Report: Pigmote Isle

Description: THE CITY CRIES OUT.
Name: A Port Report: Polythreme

Description: How fares Little London?
Name: A Port Report: Port Carnelian

Description: The curious business of the Principles perplexes and intrigues London.
Name: A Port Report: Port Cecil

Description: You never find much news on Mutton Island, but it's intelligence for the Admiralty nevertheless.
Name: A Port Report: Quaker's Haven

Description: Intriguing. How could so many people have missed so many sorrow-spiders?
Name: A Port Report: Saviour's Rocks

Description: It was a nice place once. Well, no it wasn't.
Name: A Port Report: Saviour's Rocks (Destroyed)

Description: Something has happened, or so somebody claimed.
Name: A Port Report: Shepherd Isles

Description: On the very edge of London's influence, curious matters are conducted.
Name: A Port Report: Station III

Description: A million candles glow. A congregation gathers.
Name: A Port Report: The Chapel of Lights

Description: The remains of a vast turtle shell. Voracious hunters. Rotting flesh.
Name: A Port Report: The Chelonate

Description: Only a tiny portion of the Hold is visible. But you can learn much from the comings and goings of those who visit.
Name: A Port Report: The Fathomking's Hold

Description: "A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window."
Name: A Port Report: The Iron Republic

Description: The philosophers of the swamp debate, squabble and pray.
Name: A Port Report: The Mangrove College

Description: Blow by blow, the scholars convert stone to secrets.
Name: A Port Report: The Salt Lions

Description: There's only one of it. For now.
Name: A Port Report: The Uttershroom

Description: The brightly lit town of Varchas allows visitors in limited numbers.
Name: A Port Report: Varchas

Description: Once bright, Varchas is now dark. The silence is malevolent.
Name: A Port Report: Varchas, Broken

Description: Varchas is brightly lit. The doors are locked. Outsiders are not permitted.
Name: A Port Report: Varchas, Closed to Outsiders

Description: Tomb-colonists fill their idle hours with conspiracy. Some of the conspiracies are of interest in London.
Name: A Port Report: Venderbight

Description: What were they today? What were you?
Name: A Port Report: Visage

Description: Why are there so many questions in Whither?
Name: A Port Report: Whither

Description: A prison island. Or the knot-oracles' larder.
Name: A Port Report: Wisdom

Description: Violant: the colour of necessary, but troublesome connections. According to other traditions, the colour of blood shed in a spired place. It's very hard to forget anything you've written in violant ink...
Name: A Pot of Violant Ink

Description: "There's this little place in Venderbight..."
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|You've found the Vengeance of Jonah~1|You've been told of an exceptionally fine restaurant in Venderbight.
Name: A Restaurant Recommendation

Description: Found on the Empire of Hands' beach of corpses.
AvailableAt: The picture of a small blonde baby is inside.
Name: A Rusty Locket

Description: This Clay Man looks confused as it grasps the Mirrorcatch Box in its great grey hands. It would look a lot more confused if it knew what to expect. [This will allow the Tireless Mechanic to get a night's sleep.]
Name: A Serpent-Trap

Description: This taciturn woman has business in the Corsair's Forest.
Name: A Shady Sort

Description: A past yet to be revealed
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|Your "A Stranger" quality has gone. Welcome to the world!~1|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 1. This will unlock more stories.~2|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 2. This will unlock more stories.~3|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 3. This will unlock more stories.~4|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 4. This will unlock more stories.~5|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 5. This will unlock more stories.~6|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 6. This will unlock more stories.~7|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 7. This will unlock more stories.~8|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 8. This will unlock more stories.~9|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 9. This will unlock more stories.~10|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 10. This will unlock more stories.~11|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 11. This will unlock more stories.~12|You started with a quality called "A Stranger", which has just changed to level 12. This will unlock more stories.~1000|Welcome.
Name: a stranger

Description: This is the story of the star. An exile from the High Wilderness took up a mask and a burden, and recorded its pilgrimage here below. There is no happy ending.
Name: A Travelling Light

Description: What happened to the youngest sister?
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Lost in a Fire~2|New Sisters~3|Dark Duties~10|Above the Gulf of Corinth
Name: Acquaintance: Phoebe's Fate

Description: You've been known to visit the three sisters of Hunter's Keep.
LevelDescriptionText: 2|You are acquainted with the sisters~1|You know something of Hunter's Keep~20|You are acquainted with the sisters, but something has changed.
ChangeDescriptionText: 2|You are acquainted with the sisters of Hunter's Keep.~10|You are acquainted with the sisters, but something has changed.~1|You know something of Hunter's Keep~25|You've explored the silent house on Hunter's Keep~31|The house on Hunter's Keep is aflame!~40|The house on Hunter's Keep is a blackened shell
Name: Acquaintance: Sojourning with the Sisters

Description: You were guest of honour at one of the funeral-feasts of the Replete.
Name: Adam's Way: a Guest at a Red Table

Description: It is planted in the morning, grows tall by lunch, buds in the afternoon, and withers in the evening. Foreigners must return to their ships before it falls.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The Tree of a Single Day is a hopeful sapling, green and budding.~2|The Tree of a Single Day is tall and strong. Its branches stretch over the rooftops.~3|The Tree of a Single Day is flowering. White petals drift across the square.~5|The Tree of a Single Day cracks and leans. It is time to return to your ship.~4|The Tree of a Single Day is withered. Its gnarled trunk groans.
Name: Adam's Way: the Tree of a Single Day

Description: How do they speak to you?
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Madam~2|Sir~3|Citizen~4|my lord~5|my lady~6|Captain~100|(mumble)
Name: Addressed As

Description: [This provides the advice snippet storylet. Sell it to remove this advice storylet.]
Name: ADVICE FOR CAPTAINS

Description: This content is structured but not yet written - AK to complete.
Name: AKContent

Description: AK to add quality reqs and other mechanics.
Name: AKMechanics

Description: A carpenter, weaver, engineer's hand and rat of all work.
Name: Albino Tinkerer

Description: A thinking creature made this, or the sea made this; or both.
Name: Ambiguous Eolith

Description: Now you look more closely, it appears to be new parchment stained with what smells like... coffee?
Name: An Ancient-Ish Treasure Map

Description: A notarised copy rests securely in the vaults of Baseborn & Fowlingpiece. Another, in the vaults of the Bazaar itself. [This will ensure your next character inherits your Lodgings, along with any Heirlooms you have stored there.]
Name: An Ironclad Will

Description: They won't cure the Brisk Campaigner, but perhaps they'll grant her a little more time.
Name: An Unlikely Collection of Treatments

Description: An appalling glob of organic matter and dripping fluids, retrieved from somewhere you'd rather not think about.
Name: An Unprepossessing Mass

Description: Death, laid out for your careful inspection.
Name: Anatomical Cabinet

Description: Precious time away from a captain's duties. How will you spend it? [You get one of these each time you return to London.]
Name: Another Day: A Free Evening

Description: Notepaper from Benthic College. He'd like to speak to you.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|The Alarming Scholar has invited you to call on her (him?)
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|Your business with the Alarming Scholar is concluded, for now.~1|The Alarming Scholar has invited you to call on her (him?) at the University
Name: Another Day: A Message from the Alarming Scholar

Description: Someone wants to sign on!
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Someone wants to sign on!
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Someone wants to sign on!~0|You have no more recruits for the moment.
Name: Another Day: A New Recruit?

Description: The Blind Bruiser would like a word.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|A Blind Bruiser would like a word
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|The Blind Bruiser has departed~1|A Blind Bruiser would like a word
Name: Another Day: A Visit from a Blind Bruiser

Description: Out with the old laws, in with the new.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The Parliament of Flies is open for business~5|The Calvary Doctrine is open for business~10|The Gesundheit Conspiracy is open for business~15|The Expulsus is open for business
Name: Another Day: Iron Republic Days

LevelDescriptionText: 1|Something's out there
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Horrors walk~11|Darkness coils~21|Dreams wait~31|Stone drops~41|Echo, echo...~51|Light flares~61|Wind gusts~91|Hearts pound~92|A child screams~81|Silence...silence~94|Pits gape~71|Shadows flicker~95|Still water~96|Distant laughter~97|Scuffed footsteps~98|Pale fungus~93|Spiders scuttle~99|Memories...~100|(Don't look)
Name: Another Day: Nasty Things in the Dark

Description: Travel deep enough, and you'll find something interesting.
LevelDescriptionText: 0|You've returned from the swamps!
ChangeDescriptionText: 10|Shrieks and chitters...~20|Eyes in the undernight...~30|Spreading ripples...~40|Swags of hanging fungus...~50|Fat white mosquitoes...~60|Shrieking cockatoos...~70|Sulphurous stirrings...~80|A dribble of sticky rain...~90|A moss-furred boat-skeleton...~1|Black and stinking mud...~100|A soft phosphorescence...
Name: Another Day: Navigating the Swamps

Description: Your time at zee will change you... and London.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Ever-changing
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Something has changed in the Neath
Name: Another Day: Time, the Healer

Description: The prizes you've taken await you in London. Claim them at your Lodgings.
Name: Another Day: To the Victor, the Spoils

Description: What's down here?
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You are at the edge of the Citadel.~2|You are in the second tangle of tunnels.~3|You are in the third tangle of tunnels.~5|You are in the fifth tangle of tunnels.~6|You are in the sixth tangle of tunnels.~7|You are in the seventh tangle of tunnels.~8|You have reached the Citadel's root...~9|You have entered the Citadel's root...~4|You have reached the mid-point of the Citadel
Name: Another Day: Venturing into the Shattered Citadel

Description: Someone would like to call on you at your Lodgings.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Someone would like to call on you at your Lodgings.
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|Visitors have departed.~1|Someone would like to call on you at your Lodgings.
Name: Another Day: Visitors

Description: You are learning the Waswood's silent paths. [Increase this to 7 to find what you seek.]
Name: Another Day: Where the Wood Was

Description: Perhaps a payment awaits you.
Name: Another Day:Pirate's Pleasure

Description: Carved from coral, in the Pulse of the Principles it lay.
Name: Apocyan Chess-Piece

Description: The Revenue Men have removed the most challenging elements, and applied a customs stamp to the title leaf.
Name: Approved Romantic Literature

Description: The last secret?
Name: At Last: Salt's Song

Description: You approach an exaltation.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You spoke your burning name, at last~2|You sacrificed your mortal past~4|In the Pillared City, Salt's Song waits~3|You've unravelled all your fates~5|You gave the Exile to disgrace~6|The Exile earned a kind of grace~7|The Exile turned aside her face~8|Do you recall how we came to that place?
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You spoke your burning name, at last~2|You sacrificed your mortal past~3|You've unravelled all your fates~4|In the Pillared City, Salt's Song waits~5|You gave the Exile to disgrace~6|The Exile earned a kind of grace~7|The Exile turned aside her face~8|Do you recall how we came to that place?
Name: At Last: the Threshold

Description: A sky-scarred hunk of meteoric iron, the size of a wheel-barrow. Burning glyphs mark its flanks. A star-spore lives in it. It's watching you. Are you sure you know what you're doing with this thing?
Name: Awakened Seal of the Red Science

Description: Who plucks the flax from the banks of rivers that flow through sleep?
Name: Bale of Parabola-Linen

Description: His mastery of fish-flesh would make an emperor weep.
Name: Bandaged Chef-Paramount

Description: He has an ambition for fish. A great ambition.
AvailableAt: He may sometimes be found in the Tomb-Colonies
Name: Bandaged Poissonnier

Description:
"Like a lane of beams athwart the sea,
Thro' all the circle of the golden year!" [An effective device for seeking enemies.]
Name: Blazing Glim-Lamp

Description: Soft as silence.
Name: Bolts of Spider-Silk

Description: Intelligence gleaned from the Brimstone Convention, the government-in-exile of Hell.
Name: Brimstone Buzzings

Description: She's marched with armies and cured generals. Don't annoy her.
AvailableAt: Sometimes available for hire in London.
Name: Brisk Campaigner

Description: You've been pacing yourself. Let's see them keep up with this!
Name: Burst of Speed!

Description: Tier 3 cargo ship for huge deliveries and profits.
Name: T3 Caligo-class Cargo

Description: Devours engine emissions, ensuring that your engine never explodes at Full Power. Also slightly improves your chances of evading enemy attention.
Name: Caminus Yards Avid Suppressor

Description: "IT'S A MONSTER. ARE YOU?" A powerful weapon that relies on Torpedo attacks.
Name: Caminus Yards 'Bandersnatch'

Description: A roaring beast of an engine.
Name: Caminus Yards 'Compulsion'

Description: Speak not of it.
Name: Caminus Yards 'D__nation'

Description: "Caminus Yards: We Have Always Loved You." A powerful weapon that permits Flensing attacks.
Name: Caminus Yards Heart-Ender

Description: "Caminus Yards: Stand Well Back." A weapon of savage and alarming power.
Name: Caminus Yards Hellthrasher

Description: Get Rats Where Rats Are Required, Pneumatically. [In combat, this can deploy Rattus Faber assistants for quicker repairs.]
Name: Caminus Yards Pneumatic Ratsender

Description: This is a marker quality that indicates you have a Cannon weapon equipped.
Name: Cannons

Description: You'll look away, eventually. [If you've made an Ironclad Will, you can convert these into Heirlooms for your successor.]
Name: Captivating Treasure

Description: Sealed and triple-sealed with wax.
Name: Carboy of Primordial Shrieks

Description: How secure is your hold?
Name: Cargo Security

Description: Soft-spoken and a little mystical. How much does she see?
AvailableAt: Sometimes available for hire in London.
Name: Carnelian Exile

Description: The finest output of the Greyfields shroom-yards.
Name: Cask of Mushroom Wine

Description: Increase this to 50 before Mouse reaches 1...
Name: Cat: Getting Warmer

Description: GOOD DAY. I WILL NOT CAUSE TROUBLE.
Name: Clay Man, Marked for London

Description: Sentiments and histories coil, prisoned by irrigo as the irrigo is prisoned by amber. Mourn the mind that has passed.
Name: Colossal Fluke-Core

Description: Mostly, it's immobile. Occasionally, it's feral.
Name: Comatose Ferret

Description: Provides some small degree of protection against excisemen searching your ship for contraband.
Name: Concealed Compartment

Description: How secure is your contraband against excisemen?
Name: Contraband Concealment

Description: Strictly speaking, this shouldn't be sold to civilian vessels at all, but the Admiralty has grown more casual of late.
Name: Cotterell & Hathersage 'Admiralty Special'

Description: "DON'T DO IT AGAIN." One of C&H's newer models.
Name: Cotterell & Hathersage 'Denunciation'

Description: A severe disincentive to pursuit.
Name: Cotterell & Hathersage 'Discouragement'

Description: It makes the most tremendous bang. Not what you'd call an elegant weapon, but it does make the most tremendous bang. [The Majesty is the only front-mounted pure cannon: others are torpedoes or flensing weapons.]
Name: Cotterell & Hathersage 'Majesty'

Description: Models No. 1 through No. 3 are not discussed in polite company, but this is a powerful and effective device.
Name: Cotterell & Hathersage 'Manticore No.4'

Description: This device operates in so absurd a manner as not to be easily credited. It does, nevertheless, permit torpedo attacks.
Name: Cotterell & Hathersage Pneumatic Dynamite Torpedo-Gun

Description: "WE SHALL COMPEL ATTENTION." A weapon of respectable power.
Name: Cotterell & Hathersage 'Reproach'

Description: These were poets or murderers or priests... or zee-captains. This crate bears a customs mark.
Name: Crate of Brilliant Human Souls

Description: Clinking, glowing, pleading.
Name: Crate of Human Souls

Description: How many zailors do you have aboard?
Name: Crew

Description: SHINE WHERE THOU WILT AN THOU HARM NONE. Can the Dawn Machine truly command sunlight? And would you want it to?
Name: Dawn's Law

Description: Undeliverable envelopes.
Name: Dead Post

Description: [Bring this to the shipyard in Venderbight to swap to an alternative ship.]
Name: Deeds to a Steam Yacht

Description: The Neath's greatest explorer, in her own mind at least. Take her and her bodyguard to the Empire of Hands.
Name: Delightful Adventuress

Description: These letters used to be dead, but they now have new addresses on them.
Name: Deliverable Post

Description: Now he has a cause.
Name: Determined Doctor

Description: The nature of these yellowish morsels is unclear, except that they are unlikely to be composed of deceased devils. They are kept in sealed cannisters, possibly as ammunition.
Name: Devilbone Dice

Description: He used to believe in things.
Name: Disillusioned Doctor

Description: It has claws; it has a fierce double beak; but just now it seems disinclined to use them.
Name: Docile Blemmigan

Description: You entered a sacred place.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You have despoiled a sacred place.
Name: Doom: Frostfound's Core

Description: The keenest minds are often the most fragile.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Rambling~1|Gibbering
Name: Doom: Scholar's Madness

Description: You attempted to rescue a prisoner from the prison in the Sea of Lilies...
Name: Doom: Wisdom Forewarned

Description:
'The Monster-Hunter winnows the lesser terrors from the true. She has slain That Which Makes Light in the Deeps, eaten its flesh in remembrance of certain Feasts of the Zee, and fashioned her weapon from its remains. She was human, once.' 
But this Monster-Hunter is ready for a glorious ending. Icarus in Black awaits.
Name: Doomed Monster-Hunter

Description: The awful daring of a moment's supposition which an age of ignorance can never deny. [If you sell this, you may not find it easy to replace.]
Name: Dread Surmise

Description: Still chilly from the fingers of Drownies...
Name: Drowning-Pearl

Description: Echoes are the currency of the Bazaar; and, thus, the currency of London.
Name: Echo

Description: A battered, rusting mechanism that will ensure your ship goes in more or less the correct direction.
Name: Elderly Steeple-Engine

Description: A majestically crested bird which speaks only in competent elegiac poetry. It is of a melancholy disposition.
Name: Elegiac Cockatoo

Description: And yet it moves. A piece, emission or work of the Dawn Machine.
Name: Element of Dawn

Description: The Empire of Hands has charged you with arranging deliveries of hydrogen from the Iron Republic.
Name: Empire of Hands: An Infernal Trade Agreement

Description: Whatever the Delightful Adventuress is looking for, it must be worth a fortune. If you contribute, you will be owed a share.
Name: Empire of Hands: Delightful Archeology
Empire of Hands: Explored Ash Isthmus

Description: The Empire of Hands' most sacred island, to whatever degree the monkeys are capable of such respect.
Name: Empire of Hands: Explored Fountainhead Island

Description: The only human settlement in the Empire of Hands
Name: Empire of Hands: Explored Hearthsake Island

Description: The cruel heart of the whimsical Empire of Hands
Name: Empire of Hands: Explored Sovereign Island

Description: Your current level in the Vault.
Name: Empire of Hands: Exploring the Vault of the First Emperor

Description: You have found adventure in the Empire of Hands
Name: Empire of Hands: Monkey Business

Description: It is not given lightly.
LevelDescriptionText: 2|Your ticket on board the Empire of Hands' Zeppelin. Hopefully it was worth it.~1|The Monkey Emperor's price is high, but if you want to steal his prize...
Name: Empire of Hands: Monkey Emperor's Favour

Description: This. Never. Happened.
Name: Empire of Hands: Quest For Dignity

Description: Well. You thought it was good.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|The Flying Monkey~2|The Other Name
Name: Empire of Hands: Rejected Zeppelin Name

Description: A box of incendiary documents. Simply being aware of some of them is against laws too secret to have been written.
AvailableAt: If you dare to use this, take it to Fallen London
Name: Empire of Hands: The Monkey Emperor's Wrath

Description: The Empire of Hands will need it to get where it's going.
Name: Empire of Hands: The Zeppelin - Fuel

Description: The Empire of Souls needs them to uplift its unblessed civilians.
Name: Empire of Hands: The Zeppelin - Souls

Description: The Empire of Hands will need them all where it's going.
Name: Empire of Hands: The Zeppelin - Supplies

Description: A child could solve this. Eventually...
Name: Empire of Hands: Towers of Hanoi Moves Remaining
Empire of Hands: Treasure Valley X
Empire of Hands: Treasure Valley Y

Description: Your soul resides in the Empire of Hands
Name: Empire of Hands: Unlicensed Spirifage

Description: Your current standing in the Monkey Court.
AvailableAt: Raise it by trading, supplying the Zeppelin, or amusing the fickle Pentecost Apes.
Name: Empire of Hands: Wildweald Status

Description: A chest with an embedded matrix of mirrors: an unlikely device for capturing sunlight.
Name: Empty Mirrorcatch Box

Description: You have a rival at zee.
AvailableAt: She hunts far from London, picking off both other pirates and travellers who zailed too far.
LevelDescriptionText: 20|You have once again defeated the Pirate-Poet~30|You have dined with the Pirate-Poet~40|You have forged a rivalry with the Pirate-Poet~90|You have abandoned the Pirate-Poet to the zee~99|The Pirate-Poet has written her last verse~50|You have reached a rapport with the Pirate-Poet~10|You have defeated the Pirate-Poet~0|You have heard of the Pirate-Poet
Name: Encounters with the Pirate-Poet

Description: Something has gone TERRIBLY WRONG.
Name: ENGINE OVERLOAD

Description: Tier 2 heavy ship for heavy combat situations.
Name: T2 Eschatologue-class Heavy

Description: Various events have occurred, but there's probably no need to worry, probably.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Don't worry
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Everything is probably perfectly all right.
Name: Everything is Probably Perfectly All Right

Description: How can such a thing be? Who but you could understand what it means?
Name: Extraordinary Implication

Description: Thick plates of bone have developed over the orbits, as if to hide or protect them. They are smooth and cold to the touch. Irrigo light glimmers in the line of the jaw.
AvailableAt: These can be found in the Forgotten Quarter of London, which the Genial Magician can open for you.
Name: Eyeless Skull

Description: You have a useful relationship with a coffee-house in Vienna.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You've established a useful relationship with a coffee-house in Vienna.~300|Your relationship with the Caf Ferstel has ended.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You've established a useful relationship with a coffee-house in Vienna.~2|You've sold coffee to your contact in Vienna.
Name: Favours: A Drop of Darkness

Description: A fierce old enemy of anarchists.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|An Understanding~2|A Particular Understanding
Name: Favours: A Gentleman of the Bureau

Description: You've made Khaganian friends.
Name: Favours: A Pewter Horsehead

Description: A shadowy figure has made you an offer.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You accepted the proposal~2|You agreed to smuggle souls from London to Mt Palmerston~3|You delivered souls to Mt Palmerston~4|You were paid~5|You've been asked to pick something up...~101|You refused the proposal
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You accepted the proposal~2|You agreed to smuggle souls from London to Mt Palmerston~101|You refused the proposal~3|You delivered souls to Mt Palmerston~5|You've been asked to pick something up...~4|You were paid
Name: Favours: A Proposal from a Man of Business

Description: You've made friends among the beast-slayers of the Chelonate.
Name: Favours: A Whalebone Token

Description: You have done service for the Admiralty, and they won't forget it.
Name: Favours: Admiralty's Favour

Description: You have combed the zee for stories and other treasures.
Name: Favours: Antiquarian

Description: Your gifts to the Leopard Clan have assured you a little favour.
Name: Favours: Leopard's Condescension

Description: Your gifts to the Taimen Clan have assured you a little favour.
Name: Favours: Taimen's Mercy

Description: In the roof-tops of London, the Council conspires to end the rule of law.
Name: Favours: The Calendar Council

Description: A hundred dreams in every barrel.
Name: Firkin of Prisoner's Honey

Description: Flares may be used to reveal your enemies, increasing the speed of your firing solution.
Name: Flare

Description: We've all made mistakes. If only those mistakes could be left in the dark.
AvailableAt: Purchase these at Mrs Plenty's Shipside Provisioners.
Name: Foxfire Candles

Description: A scrap of lore. [Discover monsters and locations to gain Fragments. Gain enough Fragments, and they'll combine into a Secret.]
Name: Fragment

Description: Coal, dug from zee-cliffs or imported from Hell. [If you run out of fuel, you will drift helplessly.]
Name: Fuel

Description: Her eyes will hatch soon. But until then, she wants to work.
Name: Gall-Eyed Engineer

AvailableAt: Sometimes available for hire in London.
Name: Genial Magician

Description: A scholarly creature from a warlike nation of aristocratic guinea-pigs whose progenitors stole a steamer to escape the locked hutches of a London essayist.  Apparently.
Name: Guinea Page

Description: A bucket of tiny but razor-toothed serpentlings.
Name: Harlot-Fry

Description: This is a marker quality that indicates you have a Harpoon weapon equipped.
Name: Harpoons

Description: Earnest, learned, prone to jump at loud noises.
AvailableAt: Sometimes available for hire in London.
Name: Haunted Doctor

Description: Inspire, heal, defend. [Sometimes helps with tests around Terror.]
Name: Hearts

Description: A message transmitted through the medium of death. [This is stored safely in your Lodgings.]
Name: Heirloom

Description: These do not grow on or under the world.
Name: Hesperidean Apple

Description: How much space do you have?
Name: Hold

Description: You need to find somewhere better to live. And soon.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You should look for somewhere to live.~0|You've found somewhere to live!
Name: Homeless!

Description: What kind of shape is your ship in?
Name: Hull

Description: All of us must eat.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Replete~25|Fed~50|Peckish~100|Desperate~75|Ravenous
Name: Hunger

Description: Eat the flesh of the deep-lurkers, and your eyes will change.
Name: Hunter's Eye

Description: Your prey is vanquished, but this remains.
Name: Hunting-Trophy

Description: This desperate, demented device inflicts apocalyptic damage on even the greatest zee-beasts, but it fires only one thing: Monster-Hunters. [You may find them in the Chelonate and Khan's Shadow, and occasionally elsewhere.]
Name: Icarus in Black

Description: This choice is not yet available! It will be, some day.
AvailableAt: This choice is not yet available! It will be, some day.
Name: Impossible!

Description: Your rivals are a good way behind you.
Name: In the Lead

Description: Death, where is thy sting? Where indeed. Don't mess with the Campaigner, Death.
Name: Indomitable Campaigner

Description: Oh, I say! Someone will be interested.
Name: Intriguing Snippet

Description: "I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul." [You are in Unforgiving mode, with no save slots besides the basic autosave. You will lose this token if you switch from Unforgiving to Merciful mode.]
Name: Invictus Token

Description: DESTROY. Increases the damage your attacks do.
Name: Iron

Description: Cheery enthusiasm is a welcome, but unnerving, trait in a gunner.
AvailableAt: Sometimes available for hire in London.
Name: Irrepressible Cannoneer

Description: The King's Claw keeps order on the Isle of Cats.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You have accepted Isery's Patronage~4|Delivered the Scholar's Notes to your Patron~2|Smuggling red honey to the Alarming Scholar~3|Delivered your shipment to the Alarming Scholar~5|Conducting Experiments in red honey~6|A successful experiment!~7|A friend of King's Claw~101|Refused Isery's friendship. Or lost it.
Name: Isle of Cats: Isery's Patronage

Description: She prefers Lady of the Gardens. Or just Zaira.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Accepted Zaira's Patronage~2|Smuggling red honey to the Merchant Venturer~3|Delivered the shipment to the Merchant Venturer~4|Passed the Venturer's Message to Zaira~6|Made a sacrifice to the Rose Garden~7|A friend of Zaira~101|Refused Zaira's friendship. Or lost it.
Name: Isle of Cats: Lady of the Cages' Patronage

Description: You are engaged in an activity too monstrous even to be truly illegal.
Name: Isle of Cats: Smuggling Red Honey

Description: A brooch of amber cat's eyes, and a warning.
LevelDescriptionText: 2|More "passing awareness" than notice, really~1|You are, almost entirely, beneath his notice~3|Your antics intrigue~5|You have his attention
Name: Isle of Cats: The Pirate-King's Notice

Description: Be sure their sins will find them out. [The Judgement Resonator does not limit your ability to hide.]
Name: Judgement Resonator

Description: Is this... a soul? It's pale and bright. Souls like this, they say, are the spores of strange gods.
Name: Judgements' Egg

Description: Its wings carry a thousand years of memories. Few of those memories are good.
Name: Keeper-Moth

Description: No-one has the Key of Dreams. This thing is coming soon.
Name: Key of Dreams

Description: This is a placeholder for a storyline associated with a character throughline.
AvailableAt: This is a placeholder for a storyline associated with a character throughline.
Name: Key of Faces

Description: This element is not yet implemented.
AvailableAt: This is not yet available.
Name: Key of Histories

Description: How will your kingdom be known?
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Aestival~2|New London~3|Lastport~4|Freedom~5|Utopia Beneath~6|Sophia~7|Fiddler's Gold~11|Sanctuary~12|The Empire of Trees~8|Peachtree Isle~10|Head Office~9|B____r Off
Name: Kingdom: a Name

Description: Tea is civilisation. But coffee is revolution. [Until this reaches 5, you can keep improving your Estate with coffee beans.]
Name: Kingdom: Coffee is Power

Description: Your estate grows.
Name: Kingdom: Estate

Description: Remember this day.
Name: Kingdom: Founded

Description: Intrigue might give you the leverage you need to survive as a nation. [Until this reaches 5, you can keep improving your Estate with Vital Intelligence.]
Name: Kingdom: Knowledge is Power

Description: Your subjects increase.
Name: Kingdom: Population

Description: Adorn your hall with glittering trophies.  [Until this reaches 5, you can keep improving your Estate with Artefacts.]
Name: Kingdom: Wealth is Power

Description: One rules in your absence.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|The Genial Magician~2|The Indomitable Campaigner~3|The Disillusioned Doctor
ChangeDescriptionText: 3|The Disillusioned Doctor is now your viceroy.~2|The Indomitable Campaigner is now your viceroy.~1|The Genial Magician is now your viceroy.
Name: Kingdom: your Viceroy

Description: This is all of us, one day; but let's not be in a tearing hurry about it.
Name: Lamentable Relic

Description: Tier 2 light ship. Way better than Tier 1.
Name: T1 Lampad-class Light

Description: "THE BOADICEA: MORE POWER, LESS SUBTLETY." The best Leadbeater & Stainrod can supply, although as usual they've skimped on materials.
Name: Leadbeater & Stainrod 'Boadicea'

Description: "Fear her touch!" One of L&S' more reliable pieces, which isn't saying much. Permits Flensing attacks.
Name: Leadbeater & Stainrod 'Britomart' Flensing-Cannon

Description: The 'Illyrian' is an outdated model, but it'll get you where you need to go.
Name: Leadbeater & Stainrod 'Illyrian'

Description: "THIS WAY UP." A weapon which may serve against small monsters or feeble pirates.
Name: Leadbeater & Stainrod Reconditioned Frigate-Surplus Deck-Gun Mark II

Description: A sting in your tail.
Name: Leadbeater & Stainrod 'Scorpion'

Description: 'Seaworm' torpedoes are small but lethal. Don't underestimate them.
Name: Leadbeater & Stainrod 'Seaworm'

Description: "WINNOW THE SLUMBERING GREEN!" Permits Torpedo attacks.
Name: Leadbeater & Stainrod 'Winnower'

Description: Just how far can you trust her?
LevelDescriptionText: 10|Find her mother in one of these places: Whither, the Isle of Cats, Irem, the Chelonate, Khan's Shadow, Port Carnelian or the Surface port of Naples~1000|Found her mother~2000|Visit Penstock, in London~3000|You discouraged her from passing through the Wicket~4000|She passed through the Wicket, and is gone~5000|She passed through the Wicket, and has achieved an understanding with the Bazaar
ChangeDescriptionText: 10|Apparently you've agreed to find the mother of Maybe's Daughter~1000|You've found her mother!~2000|She wants to visit Penstock, in  London~3000|You discouraged her from passing through the Wicket~4000|She passed through the Wicket, and is gone~5000|She passed through the Wicket, and has achieved an understanding with the Bazaar~20|You're searching for the mother of Maybe's Daughter. Your chances will improve with every port you search: Whither, the Isle of Cats, Irem, the Chelonate, Khan's Shadow, Port Carnelian or the Surface port of Naples
Name: Learning About: Maybe's Daughter

Description: What draws him to the zee?
LevelDescriptionText: 2|The Bandaged Poissonnier requires Strange Catches and Live Specimens for his culinary research~4|The Bandaged Poissonnier wants to study butchery at the Chelonate~5|The Bandaged Poissonnier requires zzoup and mutersalt~6|The Bandaged Poissonnier has mysterious business in Khan's Heart~7|The Bandaged Poissonnier requires either a Colossal Fluke-Core or an Elegiac Cockatoo~8|The Bandaged Poissonnier is ready to prepare a feast at the Fathomking's Hold~10|The Bandaged Poissonnier created a feast for the Fathomking~3|The Bandaged Poissonnier requires more Strange Catches or Live Specimens for his culinary research~1|A Bandaged Poissonnier at Venderbight seeks passage with a zee-captain sympathetic to intrepid cuisine
ChangeDescriptionText: 2|The Bandaged Poissonnier requires Strange Catches and Live Specimens for his culinary research.~4|The Bandaged Poissonnier wants to study butchery at the Chelonate.~5|The Bandaged Poissonnier requires zzoup and mutersalt.~6|The Bandaged Poissonnier has mysterious business in Khan's Heart.~7|The Bandaged Poissonnier requires either a Colossal Fluke-Core or an Elegiac Cockatoo.~8|The Bandaged Poissonnier is ready to prepare a feast at the Fathomking's Hold.~10|The Bandaged Poissonnier created a feast for the Fathomking.~3|The Bandaged Poissonnier requires more Strange Catches or Live Specimens for his culinary research.~1|A Bandaged Poissonnier at Venderbight seeks passage with a zee-captain sympathetic to intrepid cuisine.
Name: Learning About: The Bandaged Poissonnier

Description: There is a slight fissure in her reserve.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You've cracked the Brisk Campaigner's reserve~2|You've seen the Brisk Campaigner collapse~3|You've elected to help the Brisk Campaigner find what she needs~50|The Brisk Campaigner has recovered~100|You won't see the Campaigner again~90|The Campaigner ended your affair.~101|The Campaigner has become your viceroy.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You've cracked the Brisk Campaigner's reserve.~2|You've seen the Brisk Campaigner collapse.~3|You've elected to help the Brisk Campaigner find what she needs.~50|The Brisk Campaigner has recovered!~100|You won't see the Campaigner again.~90|The Campaigner ended your affair.~101|The Campaigner has become your viceroy.
Name: Learning About: The Brisk Campaigner

Description: What will she become?
LevelDescriptionText: 20|You answered the Exile's question.~5|You dined with the Exile.~10|You made a choice.~11|You've visited the Exile in her cabin.
ChangeDescriptionText: 5|You dined with the Exile.~10|You made a choice.~11|You've visited the Exile in her cabin.~20|You answered the Exile's question.
Name: Learning About: The Carnelian Exile

Description: You've grown closer. Is that safe?
Name: Learning About: The Cladery Heir

Description: You have an inkling of what haunts him.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You have dined with the Haunted Doctor~5|The Haunted Doctor has unburdened himself~3|You have wined the Haunted Doctor~6|The Doctor is different...~100|The Doctor is gone~101|The Doctor has become your viceroy.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You have dined with the Haunted Doctor.~3|You have wined the Haunted Doctor.~5|The Haunted Doctor has unburdened himself.~6|The Haunted Doctor is different...~100|The Doctor is gone.~101|The Doctor has become your viceroy.
Name: Learning About: The Haunted Doctor

Description: The Cannoneer  has a calmer side; although not much calmer.
LevelDescriptionText: 200|The Cannoneer has completed his masterwork~100|Take the Seal, and a Judgements' Egg, to the Iron Republic~150|Take the Seal to the heartmetal smith at Station III~10|Travel to Demeaux Island~50|Travel to Aestival, in the East~500|The Cannoneer is locked in the Rose Garden
ChangeDescriptionText: 10|Travel to Demeaux Island~200|The Cannoneer has completed his masterwork~100|Take the Seal, and a Judgements' Egg, to the Iron Republic~150|Take the Seal to the heartmetal smith at Station III~50|Travel to Aestival, in the East~500|You have sacrificed the Cannoneer to Zaira
Name: Learning About: The Irrepressible Cannoneer

Description: You know a little more about his past, now.
LevelDescriptionText: 101|The Magician has become your viceroy.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The Magician's story continues.~100|He's gone.~101|The Magician has become your viceroy.
Name: Learning About: The Magician

Description: Dressed to kill.
LevelDescriptionText: 20|You have dined with the Modiste~30|The Modiste has made herself at home~50|The Modiste seeks a new challenge in Polythreme~70|You have recovered a strange ushabti~60|The Modiste hunts an old friend~199|You have made an enemy of the Modiste~999|The Modiste is no more~80|The Modiste has reunited with an old friend~100|The Modiste has completed her work~55|The Modiste is on a Mission~200|The Modiste has struck once more~150|The Modiste is keeping to herself~0|The Modiste is a mystery
Name: Learning About: The Merciless Modiste

Description: I SHINE / TO DESCEND
Name: Learning About: The Nacreous Outcast

Description: You know a little of what drives her.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|An Acquaintance~10|A Close Acquaintance~15|Abandoned to Assassins~50|Abandoned to her Fate~20|Fought in her Defence~100|Help her Die Well~200|Bring 5 units of Romantic Literature, probably from the Khanate, to Abbey Rock~400|She's sought comfort with the Campaigner, and tomorrow she'll fight the Sisters' Adversary at Abbey Rock~500|She's ready to fight the Sisters' Adversary at Abbey Rock~300|Tomorrow she'll fight the Sisters' Adversary at Abbey Rock~1000|She died in combat against the Sisters' Adversary~2000|You watched her die in combat against the Sisters' Adversary
ChangeDescriptionText: 15|You've abandoned the Presbyterate Adventuress to assassins~20|You've helped the Presbyterate Adventuress survive an attack by her assassins~50|You've thrown the Adventuress off your ship~100|The Adventuress has asked you to help her die properly~200|You've been asked to bring 5 units of Romantic Literature, probably from the Khanate, to Abbey Rock~300|Tomorrow she'll fight the Sisters' Adversary at Abbey Rock~400|She's sought comfort with the Campaigner, and tomorrow she'll fight the Sisters' Adversary at Abbey Rock~500|She's ready to fight the Sisters' Adversary at Abbey Rock~1000|She died in combat against the Sisters' Adversary~2000|You watched her die in combat against the Sisters' Adversary
Name: Learning About: The Presbyterate Adventuress

Description: Each day, his pain is a little worse.
LevelDescriptionText: 10|Your Navigator's sigil has devoured his memories. He cannot recall his past.~15|Your Sigil-Ridden Navigator wants to go to the Chapel of Lights, to find his lost memories.~20|The Chapel of Lights has directed your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to Frostfound.~30|Speak to your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to learn what he saw at Frostfound.~40|Take your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to Avid Horizon to recover his memories.~50|Speak to your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to hear his confession.~60|peak to your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to hear his last request.~70|Your Sigil-Ridden Navigator wishes to retire. Speak with him to learn where he might find peace.~100|At Kingeater's Castle, your Sigil-Ridden Navigator met his end. A Sigil-Eaten Navigator accompanies you, now.~200|Your Sigil-Ridden Navigator has joined the Mute Exiles.~300|Your Sigil-Ridden Navigator has retired to the Empire of Hands.
ChangeDescriptionText: 20|The Chapel of Lights has directed your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to Frostfound.~30|Speak to your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to learn what he saw at Frostfound.~50|Speak to your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to hear his confession.~60|Speak to your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to hear his last request.~70|Your Sigil-Ridden Navigator wishes to retire. Speak with him to learn where he might find peace.~300|Your Sigil-Ridden Navigator has retired to the Empire of Hands.~200|Your Sigil-Ridden Navigator has joined the Mute Exiles.~100|At Kingeater's Castle, your Sigil-Ridden Navigator met his end. A Sigil-Eaten Navigator accompanies you, now.~15|Your Sigil-Ridden Navigator wants to go to the Chapel of Lights, to find his lost memories.~40|Take your Sigil-Ridden Navigator to Avid Horizon to recover his memories.~10|Your Navigator's sigil has devoured his memories. He cannot recall his past.
Name: Learning About: The Sigil-Ridden Navigator

Description: He's grateful for the company.
LevelDescriptionText: 10|Take a Clay Man and an empty Mirrorcatch Box to Hunter's Keep~20|You've learnt that the Mechanic stole a secret from the dreams of the Stone Pigs.
ChangeDescriptionText: 10|Take a Clay Man and an empty Mirrorcatch Box to Hunter's Keep~20|You've learnt that the Mechanic stole a secret from the dreams of the Stone Pigs.
Name: Learning About: The Tireless Mechanic

Description: Has he warmed to you? Or is he considering the possible uses of your organs?
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You've had dinner with the Unsettling Sage
Name: Learning About: The Unsettling Sage

Description: A name of force and resonance, abandoned in a high tower by the one who bore it. Now it's yours.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|One letter~2|Two letters~3|Three letters~4|Four letters~5|Five letters~6|Six letters~7|Seven letters: the name is complete
Name: Letters of the Name-Which-Burns

Description: Ground effect vehicle. Glides above water, therefore as light as you can get.
Name: Leuchothea-class GEV Yacht

Description: How much health a creature has.
Name: Life

Description: Tier 1 light ship for reconnaissance and speed missions.
Name: T1 Ligeia-class Light

Description: Captains have died. These things happen. Others will challenge the Unterzee.
ChangeDescriptionText: 2|A second captain has been lost to the Unterzee.~3|The Unterzee does not forgive, and it has not forgiven your third captain.~4|Four captains, now, will never return to London.~77|To lose one captain may be regarded as a misfortune. To lose seventy-seven looks like carelessness.~100|Seriously?~5|A fifth captain has given their life to the cause of exploration.~7|Seven is the number.~8|An eighth captain has gone where all captains go in the end.~9|A ninth captain gone. Let us bow our heads, but only for a moment.~10|Ten captains lost, and still the zee is hungry.~50|You are getting through a lot of captains. Never mind: there are always more.~51|So many captains, so little time.~52|The deep places teem with your forebears.~42|Another captain lost! Don't panic.~43|How many more captains will you feed to the zee?~44|The zee has taken another captain. They probably deserved it.~12|A round dozen of your captains have been abandoned to light, time and hope.~13|Unlucky thirteen. Not that the previous twelve were especially lucky.~15|Fifteen captains gone.~16|Sixteen captains gone.~17|A seventeenth captain has gone down into the abyss; yea, into the abyss.~14|A zailor's dozen of captains have been lost at zee.~25|Canst thou draw out Leviathan with a hook? Perhaps with a twenty-fifth captain? Apparently not.~69|Someone has a dirty mind.~53|Another captain down.~18|An eighteenth captain, and still the zee waits for the gifts you will bring it.~19|Nineteen captains; thirty-eight eye-sockets there in the dark.~20|Twenty captains, now. Perhaps they feast around a table in the Fathomking's castle, exchanging toasts and jokes. Perhaps their bones blacken below.~21|Twenty-one captains. We will all come to this.~22|Twenty-two captains. Timor mortis conturbat me. You too, probably.~23|Psalm 23: though you walk through the valley of the shadow of death, yet shall you fear no evil. Your captain isn't so lucky, though.~24|Two dozen captains gone! We commend your dedication.~26|Another captain lost.~70|_Another_ captain down.~78|And still they come.~11|Eleven captains. Shall we make it a dozen?~6|Six captains have made their final sacrifice.~1|Your first captain has died. DON'T WORRY. These things happen. Explore boldly with your next captain.
Name: Lineage: Captains Lost

Description: Something wriggling and peculiar. It's safely confined, probably.
Name: Live Specimen

Description: A Longshanks is a recent graduate from the urchin-gangs. But where did she learn to fire a cannon?
Name: Longshanks Gunner

Description: Watch for the fall of a card.
Name: Luck

Description: Tier 2 cargo ship for long-distance trade routes.
Name: T1 Maenad-class Cargo

Description: You know something of the Unterzee.
Name: Mariner

Description: This is what he's gathered: for Avid Horizon, and beyond.
Name: Materials for the Passage

Description: Maybe's Daughter will not yet have looked for her mother in Irem.
Name: Maybe: Irem

Description: Maybe's Daughter has not yet looked for her mother in Khan's Shadow.
Name: Maybe: Khan's Shadow

Description: Maybe's Daughter has not yet looked for her mother in Naples.
Name: Maybe: Naples

Description: Maybe's Daughter doesn't believe in your imaginary officer.
Name: Maybe: No Lilac

Description: Maybe's Daughter has not yet looked for her mother in Port Carnelian.
Name: Maybe: Port Carnelian

Description: Maybe's Daughter has not yet looked for her mother in the Chelonate.
Name: Maybe: The Chelonate

Description: Maybe's Daughter has not yet looked for her mother on the Isle of Cats.
Name: Maybe: The Isle of Cats

Description: Maybe's Daughter has not yet looked for her mother in Whither.
Name: Maybe: Whither

Description: A smile, a wink, a butterfly tattoo. An intense and detailed knowledge of weaponry and engines.
Name: Maybe's Daughter

Description: There is a pantherine glint in her eye now.
Name: Maybe's Rival

Description: "Omnia mors perimit et nulli miseretur"
Name: Memento Mori

Description: You have cast your lot in with the Cavies.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You chose the Cavies~2|You could not forge peace between the rats and cavies~3|You forged peace between the rats and cavies~4|Things have changed on Pigmote Isle
Name: Memoirs: A Knight Out of Habit

Description: The Pirate-Poet has left her mark.
LevelDescriptionText: 2|An indelible reminder of an unforgettable night~1|Obscene. Illegal. Anatomically most improbable.~0|Your skin has never known a rusty needle
Name: Memoirs: A Pirate's Tattoo

Description: You have cast your lot in with the rats.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You chose to help the rats~3|You forged peace between the rats and cavies~2|You could not forge peace between the rats and cavies~4|Things have changed on Pigmote Isle
Name: Memoirs: A Rat in the Making

Description: You've spoken to the Commodore in Grand Geode. But your memory is a little hazy.
Name: Memoirs: a Sun-Stroke

Description: You found something valuable! [Once per game, something pleasant will happen.]
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Time Is~2|Time Was
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Time is!~2|Time was!
Name: Memoirs: Beginner's Luck

Description: You found a painted serpent.
Name: Memoirs: Fingerking's Footsteps

Description: How did the Glory meet its end? The Scrimshaw Chronicler told you that the tale can be found on history's beach.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|The Scrimshaw Chronicler has asked you to seek the tale of the Glory's death "on history's beach"~20|You told the Chronicler how the Glory died~10|You know how the Glory died~40|You invented a tale of the Glory's death~50|The Chronicler left the Chelonate with you, forever~60|You lied to the Chronicler... and he will not forget it. Your association is over
Name: Memoirs: Glory's Bones

Description: Where do you hang your hat in London?
LevelDescriptionText: 1|A Room above the Blind Helmsman~2|An Elegant Townhouse~3|A Zeeside Mansion
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You now lodge in a Room above the Blind Helmsman.~2|You now lodge in an Elegant Townhouse.~3|You now lodge in a Zeeside Mansion.
Name: Memoirs: Quality of Lodgings

Description: You've heard the priest's words - seen his smile of red and white.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|St Arthur's Lesson~2|St Beau's Lesson~3|St Cerise's Lesson~4|St Destin's Lesson~5|St Erzulie's Lesson~6|St Forthigan's Lesson~7|St Gawain's Lesson~8|The Lesson of the Heart~9|The Lesson of the Core
Name: Memoirs: The Lessons of the Chapel

Description: What sign do you bear?
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Nothing at all~3|The Wheel of Mists~4|The Unflinching Eye~6|The Gambit~2|The Dauntless Hand~5|The Splendour
Name: Memoirs: Your Own Sweet Skin

Description: No one was born a zee-captain.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|A Past Wreathed in Shadows~2|A Street-Urchin~3|A Poet~4|A Soldier~5|A Fallen Priest~6|A Natural Philosopher
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|For now, you are a mystery~3|You were a Struggling Poet. Now, you're a zee-captain~2|You were a Street-Urchin. Now, you're a zee-captain~4|You were a Weary Soldier. Now, you're a zee-captain~5|You were a Fallen Priest. Now, you're a zee-captain~6|You were a Natural Philosopher. Now, you're a zee-captain
Name: Memoirs: Your Past

Description: Will your child become a zee-captain? [Raise this high enough, and you'll get a Scion.]
Name: Memoirs: Zee Fever

Description: At the University and in the tomb-colonies, they'll pay well for stories of far lands...
Name: Memory of Distant Shores

Description: A watchful hissing vapour haunts you
Name: Menaces: A Dream of Smoke

Description: All is not quite lost.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your ship is lost.~0|You've made it back to land... barely.
Name: Menaces: A Parlous Condition

LevelDescriptionText: 1|Watched
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You have begun to suffer nightmares of a vast Eye
Name: Menaces: A Recurring Nightmare

Description: You have a face-stealing abomination somewhere on your ship. It's claimed this many victims.
Name: Menaces: Crew Lost to the Snuffer

Description: The Khanate distrusts all foreign nations, but London in particular.
LevelDescriptionText: 10|your movements in the Khanate may be curtailed~1|the White-and-Golds are watching you~15|tread carefully; you should visit Khan's Glory to petition the Taimen Clan for mercy~20|you are liable to arrest in the Khanate! Visit Khan's Glory and petition the Taimen Clan
Name: Menaces: Khaganian Suspicion

Description: If you'd never had it, you'd never miss it.
Name: Menaces: Soulless

Description: Oh, you rapscallion. [This will increase as you conduct criminal activities or have contact with rough sorts. The higher your suspicion, the more fiercely the Excise will search your ship.]
Name: Menaces: Suspicion

Description: You have the cannibal taint.
Name: Menaces: Unaccountably Peckish

Description: It stings rather. [If you ever have three Wounds, you're dead. They will heal when you rest in your Lodgings, and from time to time at zee.]
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You have one Wound. At three Wounds, you'll die.~2|You have two Wounds. At three Wounds, you'll die.~3|Your wounds are mortal!
Name: Menaces: Wounds

LevelDescriptionText: 1|The light has touched you lightly~50|The light compels~100|When you close your eyes, you see the light. There is something in the North~200|Your time is over. Rise and give yourself to the Sun
ChangeDescriptionText: 30|The light is a glory.~20|The light is a wonder.~40|The light fascinates.~50|The light compels.~60|The light draws you, constantly.~70|The light is a secret electricity in your blood.~1|The light: it's pretty.~10|The light: it's like nothing else in the Neath.~80|The memory of the light is always with you.~90|The memory of the light is always with you. Go on. Open a box.~100|When you close your eyes, you see the light.~110|When you close your eyes, you see shapes in the light. Towers?~130|The towers rise, the name burns. The Sun speaks your name.~160|The towers rise, the name burns. Forget it. Rise to the Sun.~120|Whenever you close your eyes, you see the shining towers rise. The Name burns within.~200|Enough of this darkness. Go to the sun. Give yourself like a spark to smoke.~170|The Sun growls in your dreams like a pent river. Be glad.~180|You will rise to the Sun and be lost.~190|You will rise to the Sun and be lost. Soon, O God, soon.~140|The towers rise, the name burns. The Sun speaks your name above. But what lies in the East?~150|The East draws you, but so does the Sun, high above. A choice: one dissolution or another.
Name: Menaces: Yearning, Burning

Description: This frankly sinister device reduces the amount of fuel that an engine uses. It also really frightens the crew. Apparently, that's necessary.
Name: Milebreaker

Description: Detection and perception. The higher your Mirrors, the quicker you can find a firing solution in combat.
Name: Mirrors

Description: Raised by the Empire of Hands, she longs to see the wonders of the Neath.
Name: Monkey Foundling

Description: A stack of notebooks, closely written in treasure-ink.
Name: Monstrous Almanac

Description: Get back. Get back! Don't look at it directly!
Name: Montaigne Projector

Description: This was struck from the side of the Mountain-of-Light, who is the god called Stone. It is holy: treat it accordingly. [If you don't treat it as holy, it can still be sold as a Captivating Treasure.]
Name: Mountain-sherd

Description: Increase your Cat to 50 before this reaches 1...
Name: Mouse: So Little Time

Description: The nations of Europe, and beyond, compete for influence. Their plots reach even to the Neath. [The Admiral and the Diplomat, among others, will be interested to hear this.]
Name: Moves in the Great Game

Description: In the depths of the mountain lay a great egg of smooth gold. Once every hour, it pulses with slow and deadly life.
Name: Mt Nomad's Heart

Description: Tastes like clean air and crystallised ginger. Also has the interesting property of paralysing the vocal chords if you sprinkle it in your stew.
Name: Mutersalt

Description: Its brothers and sisters have abandoned it. Pearly light drips from its mantle-crest. The Principles have touched it, and not gently. But it can work miracles with salt and fish-flesh...
Name: Nacreous Outcast

Description: Pearly light still drips from its mantle-crest. But it has survived the Principles... and won something in the process.
Name: Nacreous Survivor

Description: Advice awaits you. [You acquired this from Fallen London: it'll be available for all new characters.]
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|You've heard a veteran's advice.
Name: Navigator's Counsel

Description: A token permitting you to trade in the Khanate.
Name: Nephrite Ring

Description: Your network needs you.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Your network needs something to flourish.
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|Whispers in the shadows.~1|Your network needs something.
Name: Networks - An Opportunity: Khan's Heart

Description: Your network needs you.
Name: Networks - An Opportunity: Port Carnelian

Description: This one keeps out of the way. [They will sometimes be needed to improve an espionage network]
Name: Networks: A Diplomatic Agent

Description: You have spies in Khan's Heart.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|A Nervous Informer~6|Ears in the Palaces~3|A Few Spies~2|Cautious Contacts~5|Professional Advantages~7|A Masterful Web~4|A Respectable Network
Name: Networks: Khan's Heart

Description: You have spies in Port Carnelian.
Name: Networks: Port Carnelian

Description: She's a little more sombre than she used to be.
Name: Nobody's Daughter

Description: The inhabitants of Nuncio are slow to friendship, and suspicious.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|A Newcomer~4|Accepted by the Locals~6|Trusted in Nuncio
Name: Nuncio: Cultivating Friendships with Postmen

Description: You gave a postman an opportunity to leave Nuncio.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You gave a postman an opportunity to leave Nuncio.~0|You have been repaid by the postman that you saved.
Name: Nuncio: Deliverance

Description: You are discovering how things are at Nuncio.
LevelDescriptionText: 3|Interviewer of Postmen~4|Burner of Letters~5|Explorer of the Lower Basements~7|Visitor to the Centre-stone~1|Aware of Flotsam and Jetsam~2|Familiar with the Pull~6|Familiar with the Flaming Letters~10|At Peace with the Post~9|Bitter about Postal Incompetence~8|Understanding of Postal Work
Name: Nuncio: Learned in Postal Secrets

Description: Experienced in shift work at the Dead Letter Office.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Invited to Serve~2|Working Shifts~3|Experienced Shiftworker~4|Authorised for Back Room Access~5|Basement Custodian
Name: Nuncio: Worker in Dead Letters

Description: How do you want it all to end? [This determines how you win: although you can always just retire in London, for a draw.]
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Find your father's bones, and then retire~2|Retire to a life of luxury~3|Become London's most venerated explorer~4|Found your own private kingdom~5|Sail East, beyond the Zee
Name: Objective: Ambition

Description: The Admiralty has a task for you. Visit the named port to retrieve Strategic Intelligence, and return it to the Admiralty.
LevelDescriptionText: 3|Retrieve Strategic Information from Whither, far north of London~7|Retrieve Strategic Information from Mt Palmerston,  somewhere north-east of London~8|Retrieve Strategic Information from Port Cecil in the Principles of Coral, somewhere north-east of London~4|Retrieve Strategic Information from Codex, far north of London~5|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Chapel of Lights, somewhere north-east of London~0|No Current Commission~6|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Avid Horizon, somewhere north-east of London~11|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Cumaean Canal, South along the coast from London~12|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Mangrove College, in the Swallowing Isles~1|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Iron & Misery Company Funging Station, somewhere not far from home waters~9|Retrieve Strategic Information from Polythreme, somewhere a good way east of London~10|Retrieve Strategic Information from Khan's Heart, somewhere a good way east of London~2|Retrieve Strategic Information from Gaider's Mourn in the Corsair's Forest, somewhere not far from home waters~13|Retrieve Strategic Information from Frostfound, in the North~14|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Chelonate, far to the East~15|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Empire of Hands, far to the East~16|Retrieve Strategic Information from Saviour's Rocks, far to the East~17|Retrieve Strategic Information from Khan's Shadow, somewhere a good way east of London~18|Retrieve Strategic Information from Nuncio, somewhere east of London~19|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Iron Republic, somewhere south of London~20|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Grand Geode, somewhere south of London
ChangeDescriptionText: 3|Retrieve Strategic Information from Whither, far north of London~4|Retrieve Strategic Information from Codex, far north of London~5|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Chapel of Lights, somewhere north-east of London~7|Retrieve Strategic Information from Mt Palmerston, somewhere north-east of London~8|Retrieve Strategic Information from Port Cecil in the Principles of Coral, somewhere north-east of London~11|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Cumaean Canal, South along the coast from London~0|You've completed your Commission - return to the Admiralty.~6|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Avid Horizon, somewhere north-east of London~12|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Mangrove College, in the Swallowing Isles~1|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Iron & Misery Company Funging Station, somewhere not far from home waters~2|Retrieve Strategic Information from Gaider's Mourn in the Corsair's Forest, somewhere not far from home waters~9|Retrieve Strategic Information from Polythreme, somewhere a good way east of London~10|Retrieve Strategic Information from Khan's Heart, somewhere a good way east of London~13|Retrieve Strategic Information from Frostfound, in the North~14|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Chelonate, far to the East~15|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Empire of Hands, far to the East~16|Retrieve Strategic Information from Saviour's Rocks, far to the East~17|Retrieve Strategic Information from Khan's Shadow, somewhere a good way east of London~18|Retrieve Strategic Information from Nuncio, somewhere east of London~19|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Iron Republic, somewhere south of London~20|Retrieve Strategic Information from the Grand Geode, somewhere south of London
Name: Objective: An Admiralty Commission

Description: You've been asked to pick up a package and return it to London. Don't come back without it.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Collect from Gaider's Mourn, in the Corsairs' Forest~2|Collect from Polythreme, in the Sea of Voices~3|Collect from Khan's Heart, in the Salt Steppes
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You've been asked to collect a package from Gaider's Mourn, in the Corsairs' Forest~2|You've been asked to collect a package from Polythreme, in the Sea of Voices~3|You've been asked to collect a package from Khan's Heart, in the Salt Steppes
Name: Objective: Collecting Cargo for the Cheery Man

Description: The uses of the stone are mysterious. Where must you take it?
LevelDescriptionText: 10|You've run several loads of Sphinxstone~1|You've been running Sphinxstone to London~50|You've agreed to take this last load of Sphinxstone to the Grand Geode~60|You've refused to take this last load of Sphinxstone to the Grand Geode~150|You've delivered your last load of Sphinxstone~101|Deliver Sphinxstone to the Flit, in London~102|Deliver Sphinxstone to Irem, in the distant East~103|Deliver Sphinxstone to the Chelonate, in the East~104|Deliver Sphinxstone to your old church, in London~105|Deliver Sphinxstone to Adam's Way, in the South
ChangeDescriptionText: 101|Deliver the Sphinxstone to the Flit, in London, where the wind walks~102|Deliver the Sphinxstone to Irem, in the East, the place where things become real~103|Deliver the Sphinxstone to the Chelonate, in the East, where pain is remembered~104|Deliver the Sphinxstone to your old church, in London, where they need an altar~105|Deliver the Sphinxstone to Adam's Way, in the South, where the Replete wait~1|You've delivered Sphinxstone~50|Deliver the Sphinxstone to the Grand Geode, somewhere along the coast to the South~60|You've refused to deliver Sphinxstone to the Grand Geode~150|You've delivered the last load of Sphinxstone~100|Deliver Sphinxstone to the Shrine of St Joshua, in London
Name: Objective: Deliveries from the Salt Lions

Description: She's the guardian of the Brimstone Convention. Apparently.
LevelDescriptionText: 20|You've taken tea with the Wistful Deviless~30|You've satisfied the Deviless' yearning for souls.~100|You've brought the Deviless back to London.~110|You've spoken to the Deviless in London.~80|You have left Mt Palmerston with the Deviless on board~40|The Deviless has asked you to take something back to London.~50|You have carried intelligence to the Brass Embassy.~60|The Deviless has given you a second, more valuable, message for the Brass Embassy.~200|You warned the Deviless that Hell would not welcome her, and left her in Mt Palmerston.~150|You returned the Deviless to the Brass Embassy...who knew of her betrayal.~1|You've found a little cottage by the gate to the Brimstone Convention.~70|The Brass Embassy has sent you back to fetch the Deviless from Mt Palmerston
Name: Objective: Encounters with the Wistful Deviless

Description: You've found a hidden Ambition! Colonise and improve Aestival to found your own kingdom.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|To found a colony, bring something to Aestival that can protect against sunlight.~2|Increase your colony's Population to 77 and Estate to 100, and ensure you have assigned a Viceroy.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|To found a colony, bring something to Aestival that can protect against sunlight.~2|Increase your colony's Population to 77 and Estate to 100, and ensure you have assigned a Viceroy.
Name: Objective: Kingdom

Description: "We need once-living monster-material. And since we can't get the heart of the Bazaar (no, we really can't), we'll need something from the Dawn Machine. Sorry."[Take one Element of Dawn, one Casket of Sapphires, and forty units of Stygian Ivory, along with the Mechanic's Secret and the Unsettling Sage, to Kingeater's Castle.]
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Take one Element of Dawn, one Casket of Sapphires, and forty units of Stygian Ivory, along with the Mechanic's Secret and the Unsettling Sage, to Kingeater's Castle.
Name: Objective: Materials for the Impeller

Description: Even Pirate-Kings like their courtesies
AvailableAt: Your Patron suggested the Cumaean Canal.
LevelDescriptionText: 2|You have a Surface sailor imprisoned below-decks~3|You have handed your tear-stained cargo over to your Patron~1|You are seeking a gift for the Pirate-King
Name: Objective: Seeking a Gift for the Pirate-King

Description: You are investigating Snuffers.
LevelDescriptionText: 100|He has a commission for you~200|He wants you to catch a Snuffer in Port Carnelian~300|You have captured Port Carnelian's Snuffer and are to return it to the Broker in Adam's Way~400|He has another commission for you~500|You are to escort a Hands-On Diplomat to the Presbyterate's embassy in London~1000|You completed the Broker's commission as instructed~2000|You betrayed the Broker and warned his target
Name: Objective: The Avuncular Broker's Little Problem

Description: You are seeking the phrase that will open a whisper-locked sea-chest.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|The Scholar suggested you seek answers in Irem, in the far north-east from London.~21|Isery, the King's Claw, has given you an address in London.~22|Answer the Widower's two remaining questions.~23|Answer the Widower's remaining question.~24|Decide what to do with the box.
ChangeDescriptionText: 21|Isery, the King's Claw, has given you an address in London.~1|The Scholar has suggested you seek answers in Irem, in the far north-east from London.~22|You have answered the first of the Widower's questions.~23|You have answered the second of the Widower's questions.~24|You have answered all of the Widower's questions... and you know how to open the box.~11|The Iremi appears to be suggesting you look to the Isle of Cats, somewhere in the south of the zee. Probably.
Name: Objective: The Box from the Sea

Description: "I had to hide the Secret somewhere the Fingerkings couldn't go. I hoped they'd leave me alone then. So I put it in Frostfound. Not the very heart of Frostfound. I'm not insane. But, um, quite close to the heart." [Find Frostfound, in the north, and retrieve the Mechanic's secret from the penultimate chamber.]
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Find Frostfound, in the north, and retrieve the Mechanic's secret from the penultimate chamber.
Name: Objective: The Mechanic's Secret in Frostfound

Description: "I'll need help to build the engine. It'll need to be alive, like the Pigs, and I'm, er, better at metal." [Rescue or ransom him from Wisdom, in the Sea of Lilies near the Khanate to help the Tireless Mechanic complete his project.]
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Rescue or Ransom him from Wisdom
Name: Objective: The Unsettling Sage

Description: He has a plan.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|A Dream and a Scheme~20|North, to Avid Horizon~100|The Venturer is gone~11|Preparations Complete~50|The Venturer is gone
Name: Objective: The Venturer's Venture

Description: Just what precisely is their problem?
LevelDescriptionText: 40|Bring wine to Venderbight~50|Open a monstrous eel~110|You brought wine to Venderbight for your passenger~120|You brought wine to Venderbight, and drank it with your passenger~130|You returned a father to Venderbight, and listened to his story~140|You returned a father to Venderbight, and wouldn't hear his story~150|You brought an absent friend to Venderbight, and were tactful~160|You brought an absent friend to Venderbight, and were truthful~1|Take the colonist to Venderbight~170|You brought a criminal to Venderbight, and assisted her~180|You brought a criminal to Venderbight, but let the authorities pick her up~100|You brought a tomb-colonist to Venderbight, only for them to dissolve~190|You brought a tomb-colonist to Venderbight, and defeated them in an unexpected duel~200|You brought a tomb-colonist to Venderbight, and they rudely assaulted you~60|Bring a Shady Sort to Venderbight from the Mangrove College~501|The Last Tour - Corsair's Forest~551|The Last Tour - Shepherd's Wash~601|The Last Tour - Khan's Glory~651|The Last Tour - Polythreme~701|The Last Tour - Irem~900|The Last Tour - back to Venderbight~1000|The Last Tour is complete!~751|The Last Tour - the Chelonate~70|You rescued a father from a monstrous eel, and need to take him to Venderbight~300|The Last Tour, again
