ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Take the colonist to Venderbight~40|Bring wine to Venderbight~50|Open a monstrous eel~60|Bring a Shady Sort to Venderbight from the Mangrove College~100|You brought a tomb-colonist to Venderbight, only for them to dissolve~110|You brought wine to Venderbight for your passenger~120|You brought wine to Venderbight, and drank it with your passenger~130|You returned a father to Venderbight, and listened to his story~140|You returned a father to Venderbight, and wouldn't hear his story~150|You brought an absent friend to Venderbight, and were tactful~160|You brought an absent friend to Venderbight, and were truthful~170|You brought a criminal to Venderbight, and assisted her~180|You brought a criminal to Venderbight, but let the authorities pick her up~190|You brought a tomb-colonist to Venderbight, and defeated them in an unexpected duel~200|You brought a tomb-colonist to Venderbight, and they rudely assaulted you~651|The Tour continues. To Polythreme!~701|The Tour continues. To Irem!~1000|The Tour is complete.~751|The Tour continues. To the Chelonate!~70|You rescued a father from a monstrous eel, and need to take him to Venderbight~300|It seems the Last Tour was not entirely Last.~900|The Tour should return to Venderbight, now.~601|The Tour continues. To Khan's Glory!~501|You're taking a dozen tomb-colonists on their last Tour... first, to the Corsair's Forest~551|You're taking a dozen tomb-colonists on their last Tour... first, to Shepherd's Wash
Name: Objective: Tomb-Colonists

Description: He wants...
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Find seven Strange Catches or seven Hunting Trophies~2|Find seven Hunting Trophies or seven pieces of Scintillack~3|Find seven pieces of Scintillack or seven volumes of Romantic Literature~4|Find seven volumes of Romantic Literature or twenty-one bolts of Spider-Silk~5|Find twenty-one bolts of Spider-Silk, or seven skins of Zzoup~6|Find seven skins of Zzoup, or seven packages of Mutersalt~7|Find seven packages of Mutersalt, or seven Devilbone Dice~8|Find seven Devilbone Dice, or seven Outlandish Artefacts~9|Find seven Outlandish Artefacts, or seven bales of Parabola-Linen~10|Find seven bales of Parabola-Linen, or seven pieces of Stygian Ivory~11|Find seven pieces of Stygian Ivory, or seven Caskets of Sapphires~12|Find seven Caskets of Sapphires, or one Lorn-Fluke Core~13|Find one Lorn-Fluke Core, or seven Lamentable Relics~14|Find seven Lamentable Relics, or seven Sacks of Darkdrop Coffee
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The Venturer has a request... speak to him further, or check your Journal
Name: Objective: Venturer's Desire

Description: Your ship's instrumentation relies on the energies of night. You may employ Unclear Devices.
Name: Obscure Energies

Description: You are playing with the original Pigmote Isle
Name: OldPigmote

Description: This belongs in a museum! Assuming that colonial-imperial appropriation for the purpose of hegemonic taxonomisation is a suitable response to the problem of intercultural contact. Which it probably is, because museums are magnificent institutions.  [If you've made an Ironclad Will, you can convert a collection of these into an Heirloom for your successor.]
Name: Outlandish Artefact

Description: Esoteric and occasionally practical knowledge. [Increases the speed at which you convert Fragments to Secrets.]
Name: Pages

Description: Hold up a mirror and see its other self: a panther cub, grey as night-fog but touched with amber.
Name: Parabolan Kitten

Description: A dignified tortoiseshell-tabby, notable mainly for her fondness for mackerel. But the zailors treat her with exaggerated respect. They've seen what she looks like in a mirror...
Name: Parabolan Panther

Description: Tier 1 heavy ship for use in combat and hazardous environment conditions.
Name: T1 Phorcyd-class Heavy

Description: How will you advise?
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|A Dilemma! How will you advise Pigmote Isle?~0|You have resolved the dilemma, for better or worse.
Name: Pigmote Isle: A Dilemma

Description: A nation must build. If this reaches 0, bad things will happen on Pigmote Isle.
LevelDescriptionText: 0|Catastrophe~1|DANGER~7|Cultured~9|Dignified~10|Magnificent~8|Distinguished~2|Danger~5|Unexceptional~6|Rising~3|Struggling~4|Troubled
Name: Pigmote Isle: Civilisation

Description: Two houses, alike in dignity. Not that this is saying much, mind.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Cavia~2|Murinia~51|United Cavia~52|United Murinia~61|Cavia (Fighting For Independence)~62|Murinia (Fighting For Independence)~21|Cavia and Visage~22|Murinia and Visage~32|Murinia and His Complexity~95|You have been banished from Pigmote Isle~99|Pigmote has fallen
ChangeDescriptionText: 40|The battle for Pigmote Isle has begun. Return later to see the outcome.~99|Pigmote Isle has fallen.~1|Hail Cavia!~2|Hail Murinia!~21|Cavia has allied with Visage.~22|Murinia has allied with Visage.~31|Cavia has allied with the Fathomking.~32|Murinia has allied with the Fathomking.~51|Hail United Cavia!~52|Hail United Murinia!~62|Murinia fights for independence.~61|Cavia fights for independence.~95|You have been banished from Pigmote Isle.
Name: Pigmote Isle: Mastery

Description: A nation must be strong. If this reaches 0, bad things will happen on Pigmote Isle.
LevelDescriptionText: 7|Strong~9|Mighty~10|Ascendant~0|Catastrophe~8|Hardy~1|DANGER~2|Danger~3|Weak~5|Adequate~6|Unimposing~4|Vulnerable
Name: Pigmote Isle: Might

Description: Time passes on the Neath's most adorable empire.
LevelDescriptionText: 31|Pigmote's fate has been decided~1|A new nation has been founded~40|Pigmote fights for independence~999|Life continues on Pigmote Isle~99|Pigmote's dream is over~30|Pigmote must decide its fate
ChangeDescriptionText: 31|Pigmote's fate has been decided.~1|A new nation has been founded.~2|Time passes on Pigmote Isle.~30|Pigmote must decide its fate.~40|Pigmote's war for independence has begun.~999|Life continues on Pigmote Isle.~99|Pigmote lies in ruins.~10|Pigmote Isle approaches a crossroads.~8|Great ships have been dispatched to Pigmote Isle.~6|The eyes of the zee turn to Pigmote Isle.
Name: Pigmote Isle: Progress Of A Nation

Description: A nation needs hope. If this reaches 0, bad things will happen on Pigmote Isle.
LevelDescriptionText: 0|Catastrophe~9|Delighted~10|Triumphant~1|DANGER~2|Danger~3|Conflicted~5|Content~4|Argumentative~6|Optimistic~7|Pleased~8|Happy
Name: Pigmote Isle: Spirit

Description: Like a human heart, but not very. After all, in the end, she was only clay.
Name: Pirate-Poet's Heart

Description: He probably won't saw the wrong limb off.
Name: Plausible Surgeon

Description: But who is the cat, and who the mouse?
LevelDescriptionText: 4|An Absentee Aunt~5|An Eccentric Burglar~6|A Deranged Medium~1|A Disgruntled Naval Officer~2|A Masked Clay Man~3|An Enterprising Astronomer
Name: Playing Cat and Mouse with an Evasive Target

Description: Your ship enjoys the benefits of pneumatic engineering.
Name: Pneumatic Delivery

Description: Perhaps she's afraid of being forgotten. She isn't afraid of much else.
AvailableAt: Sometimes available for hire in London.
Name: Presbyterate Adventuress

Description: This is the Price Unpaid.
Name: Price Unpaid

Description: "And bring me a Fluke-Core. For my Kin."
Name: Principles' End: A Fluke-Core

Description: "Bring me a little flint, to be my new Paw," the Principles said
Name: Principles' End: A Little Flint

Description: "Bring me a monster's tooth, to be my new Night.", the Principles said
Name: Principles' End: A Monster's Tooth

Description: "Bring me a Wakeful Idol, to be my new Bishop," the Principles said
Name: Principles' End: A Wakeful Idol

Description: "Bring me heart-shelled silver, to be my new Root", the Principles said.
Name: Principles' End: Heart-Shelled Silver

Description: The coral is changing...
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Pursuing chess in the Principles~5|Speaking with the Principles~10|Seeking the Salt-Lions~15|Seeking further pieces~25|At the end-game~200|A victory~100|A stalemate~11|Returning with Sphinxstone
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Opening moves.~2|Initial gambits.~3|Developments.~4|Gambits answered.~5|An extra move.~6|An opening.~10|A minor piece.~25|At the end-game~100|A stalemate~200|A victory
Name: Principles' End: Principality

Description: You have made your mark in the chess-contests of the Principles of Coral.
Name: Principles' End: Principled Competition

Description: You have confined this unfortunate to a cage in the hold. [Prisoners survive on scraps and do not usually require Supplies. Release your Prisoner by using this item, or take them back to London for other purposes...]
Name: Prisoner

Description: You've sown blemmigans on a Light-Ship.
Name: Propagation: a Light-Ship

Description: You've sown blemmigans on Abbey Rock. No doubt if the nuns object, they'll do something about it.
Name: Propagation: Abbey Rock

Description: You've sown blemmigans at Adam's Way.
Name: Propagation: Adam's Way

Description: You've dropped blemmigans on Aestival, which seems rather a shame.
Name: Propagation: Aestival

Description: You have graciously transported blemmigans to this many islands.
Name: Propagation: Blemmigans Abroad

Description: You've sown blemmigans at Demeaux Island.
Name: Propagation: Demeaux Island

Description: You've introduced blemmigans to the Empire of Hands.
Name: Propagation: Empire of Hands

Description: You've sown blemmigans on Gaider's Mourn. Perhaps they'll find a foothold somewhere.
Name: Propagation: Gaider's Mourn

Description: You've sown blemmigans on Godfall. No doubt they will find nutrients in the corridors of the Shattered Citadel.
Name: Propagation: Godfall

Description: You've sown blemmigans on Hunter's Keep.
Name: Propagation: Hunter's Keep

Description: You've sown blemmigans at Irem. Or, perhaps, you will sow them.
Name: Propagation: Irem

Description: You've sown blemmigans at Khan's Heart.
Name: Propagation: Khan's Heart

Description: You've sown blemmigans at Khan's Shadow.
Name: Propagation: Khan's Shadow

Description: Nothing will take root here.
Name: Propagation: Not Kingeater's Castle

Description: You've sown blemmigans on Nuncio.
Name: Propagation: Nuncio

Description: You've sown blemmigans on Pigmote Isle... perhaps introducing a third term to a delicate equation.
Name: Propagation: Pigmote Isle

Description: You've sown blemmigans on Polythreme. Who knows what will come of it?
Name: Propagation: Polythreme

Description: You've sown blemmigans at Port Carnelian.
Name: Propagation: Port Carnelian

Description: You have sown blemmigans at Saviour's Rocks. They'll fill any dark crevice not blocked with cobweb.
Name: Propagation: Saviour's Rocks

Description: You've sown blemmigans on the Shepherd Isles. No-one will believe it.
Name: Propagation: Shepherd Isles

Description: The blemmigan has crept in through the triple-locked gate.
Name: Propagation: STATION III

Description: You have sown the Chapel's island with blemmigans. They probably won't enjoy it much.
Name: Propagation: The Chapel of Lights

Description: You've sown blemmigans at the Chelonate.
Name: Propagation: The Chelonate

Description: Apparently blemmigans are welcome at the Hold.
Name: Propagation: The Fathomking's Hold

Description: Blemmigans are here. Were here. Or at least will be here.
Name: Propagation: The Iron Republic

Description: You've sown blemmigans at the Isle of Cats. How will they react to the bees?
Name: Propagation: The Isle of Cats

Description: Blemmigans flourish among the deep mangroves.
Name: Propagation: The Mangrove College

Description: In the creases of the great stone beast, blemmigans sprout.
Name: Propagation: The Salt Lions

Description: Perhaps your blemmigan walks in the light of Mihir.
Name: Propagation: Varchas

Description: You've brought new, and purple, life to the tomb-colonies.
Name: Propagation: Venderbight

Description: You've sown blemmigans on Visage. It can hardly make the place any stranger.
Name: Propagation: Visage

Description: "You wants someone to take a look inside that." [Rattus Faber Assistants are essential for use of the Pneumatic Rat Delivery Device.]
Name: Rattus Faber Assistant

Description: Sizzling with cosmogone light. It has absorbed radiations not of this earth. Some of its colours can only be seen in sleep.
Name: Ray-Drenched Cinder

Description: Outlying colonies are often eager for this. [You can't collect more than one Recent News at a time.]
Name: Recent News

Description: You have known a sweet and dreamless sleep. [This will strengthen you when you struggle against Nightmares.]
Name: Restful Night

Description: Oho! [The Dark-Spectacled Admiral will want to see this, if your Admiralty's Favour is high enough.]
Name: Revelatory Chart

Description: Born, sired, or adopted, they're yours.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You have a child~10|Your child calls you Father~11|Your child calls you Mother~12|Your child calls you Captain~20|Your child has gone to zee
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You have a child~10|You are a father~11|You are a mother~12|You are something significant in this child's life. They call you 'Captain'~20|Your child has gone to zee!
Name: Romance: a Child in London

Description: Something has occurred.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Something new.
Name: Romance: a Notable Occasion

Description: The heart is a heedless hunter. [You are engaged in a discreet liaison with one of your Officers.]
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Sly Navigator~2|Longshanks Gunner~8|Cladery Heir~4|Campaigner~3|Mechanic~7|The Daughter~6|Magician~5|Nacreous Survivor
ChangeDescriptionText: 2|You have begun an affair with the Longshanks Gunner~1|You have begun an affair with the Sly Navigator~3|You have begun an affair with the Tireless Mechanic~4|You have begun an affair with the Campaigner~5|You have begun an affair with the Nacreous Survivor~6|You have begun an affair with the Magician~7|You have begun an affair with Maybe's Daughter~8|You have begun an affair with the Cladery Heir
Name: Romance: an Affair with...

Description: You have engaged in a liaison with one of your officers, out at zee.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You have been fraternising with one of your officers.
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|For now, your affair with your officer is forgotten.~1|You have fraternised with one of your officers.
Name: Romance: Love in the Dark

Description: You chose a sweetheart in Fallen London.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You have a sweetheart in London.~0|They're gone.~100|You had a sweetheart in London
Name: Romance: Someone Back Home

Description: All the adventures of the heart are here, in prose, poetry or pictorial form. Some may be more suitable for private consumption. [Note: in London, customs duty is paid on love stories. Even illustrated love stories.]
Name: Romantic Literature

Description: Light as a thought, and jewel-bright
AvailableAt: Hunt Blue Prophets or Milliner-Bats to find these.
Name: Royal-Blue Feather

Description: The pirates of Gaider's Mourn tell many tales of this clay corsair.
LevelDescriptionText: 0|The Pirate-Poet is roaming the zee~5|The Pirate-Poet is being hunted~6|The Pirate-Poet is not currently at zee~99|The Pirate-Poet is believed dead~90|The Pirate-Poet is said to be lost at zee~10|The Pirate-Poet is believed to be a prisoner
Name: Rumours of the Pirate-Poet

Description: All the fire of Hell, and all the aroma of Heaven.
Name: Sack of Darkdrop Coffee Beans

Description: It only lasts so long...
LevelDescriptionText: 1|The Festival of Silk begins~6|The Festival of Silk draws to a close~2|The Festival of Silk warms up~3|The Festival of Silk fills the island with cheer~4|The Festival of Silk is in full swing~5|The Festival of Silk feels like it will never end~7|The Festival of Silk is ending~8|The Festival of Silk is over
Name: Saviour's Rocks: At the Festival of Silk

Description: If you're lucky, it will only kill you.
Name: Saviour's Rocks: Avaricious Lorn-Fluke's Will

Description: You have encountered the grand spider-council of Saviour's Rocks.
LevelDescriptionText: 0|A Stranger to Spiders~99|A Scourge of Spiders~30|A Supplicant of Spiders~90|A Spurner of Spiders~40|A Scavenger for Spiders~50|A Salvager for Spiders~75|A Stooge of Spiders~20|A Supplier to Spiders~10|A Supplier of Tomb Colonists to Spiders?
Name: Saviour's Rocks: Caught in the webs of Saviour's Rocks

Description: She's not ready for a fight like this!
Name: Saviour's Rocks: Nocturne Integrity

Description: They are always watching. So are you.
Name: Saviour's Rocks: Spying on the Sorrow Spiders

Description: Every ship has its secrets.
Name: Saviour's Rocks: The Fate of the Nocturne

Description: Saviour's Rocks gives thanks to its generous neighbours
LevelDescriptionText: 1|The Festival of Silk has begun~2|The Festival of Silk is over~5|The Festival of Silk is cancelled~6|The Festival of Silk is cancelled forever
Name: Saviour's Rocks: The Festival of Silk

Description: She's falling apart, but at least she doesn't have far too go.
Name: Saviour's Rocks: The Final Voyage of the Nocturne

Description: Definitely not sorrow-spider eggs. Deliver them to Fallen London.
Name: Saviour's Rocks: Trinkets. Just Trinkets.

Description: Waiting for an audience with the spider-council of Saviour's Rocks.
Name: Saviour's Rocks: Walk Into My Parlour, Said...

Description: Coral that glimmers as if moonlit. It makes marvellous jewellery or terribly expensive tea.
Name: Scintillack

Description: Your line will continue. [You have established a dynasty of zee-captains. This will persist between captains, unless something happens to end it.]
Name: Scion

Description: The Chronicler's heart is weary, but his meals are hearty... and he can make soup out of almost anything.
Name: Scrimshaw Chronicler

Description: A sky-scarred hunk of meteoric iron, the size of a wheel-barrow. Burning glyphs mark its flanks.
Name: Seal of the Red Science

Description: Mysteries are fire. Truth burns.
Name: Searing Enigma

Description: The root of all good. [Discuss Secrets with your Officers to improve your skills. You can speak to your Officers by right-clicking their portraits.]
Name: Secret

Description: Ensure that no-one gets in without the key. In... or out.[This will help protect against acquisitive passengers and over-lively cargo.]
Name: Secure Compartment

Description: Look how it glides. Like moonlight.
Name: Serene Aquarium

Description: He can render the supplies edible, if not palatable.
Name: Shady Cook

Description: A kind of glory.
Name: Shining Knight

Description: A glittering altar carved with the Signs of the South.
Name: Shrine to Stone

Description: More Sigil than man, now. But he sets a true course.
Name: Sigil-Eaten Navigator

Description: Has that tattoo grown since last you looked?
AvailableAt: Sometimes available for hire in London, or more reliably at the Shepherd Isles.
Name: Sigil-Ridden Navigator

Description: Competent? Probably. Trustworthy? Possibly.
Name: Sly Navigator

Description: A monstrous weapon of monstrous heartmetal.
Name: Smith's Anguish

Description: A Miraculous New Process Enables Passage Through Eternal Night! Do Not Consume.  [An adequate device for seeking enemies.]
Name: Soft Glim-Lamp

Description: In smaller quantities, delightful and refreshing. In larger quantities, one of the very nicest ways to die.
AvailableAt: This grows in the Wisp-Ways, near the Mangrove College.
Name: Solacefruit

Description: You'll find a story when you next make port. [You'll receive this from time to time as you travel the zee.]
LevelDescriptionText: 0|Nothing awaits you. Time to leave port?~1|Stories await when you next make port.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The waves are flecked with light.~50|Zee-bats cry out. They are nothing like birds.~39|Something drifts, face-down.~47|A false-star flares in the cavern roof directly above you; flares, and fades.~78|A tiny breeze stirs your hair, and dies.~81|Waves slap the side of the ship. Far below, something moves.~40|Some sort of beetle has invaded your morsel of ship's biscuit. It waggles its antennae impertinently.~20|Green glass and basalt. Salt and silence.~37|The glim-lamp at the prow fizzes, arcs.~30|On the horizon, a sickly yellow light glimmers for a moment, then fades.~49|Where is everyone? Where did they go? ...they're here. They're here. You're not alone.~60|Distant bells.~100|Blue lightnings crawl leisurely up the funnel. "St Erasmus dancing!" the cry goes up.~82|Home. Warmly lit windows, company, peace. Thoughts of home come at the strangest times.~90|The air trembles. A breath of change passes...~25|The glassy chop of dark water. The iron clatter of feet at the hatchway.~10|The air carries the scent of salt and shadows.~43|A zailor raises her head, sniffs sharply. Blood on the wind. ~19|The scent of the zee! Salt and frost and cellars. Black spices.~70|Luminescent beasts like eyeless dolphins play in your wake.~68|A zailor is praying.~74|A sluggish wave. The ship pitches.~84|Far off, very far off, someone screams...~86|Laughter from the fore-deck.~88|A belch of smoke goes up from the funnel.~11|The air trembles. A breath of change passes...~12|A belch of smoke goes up from the funnel.~13|Laughter from the fore-deck.~14|Far off, very far off, someone screams...~85|Zee-bats cry out. They are nothing like birds.~16|A zailor is praying.~17|Luminescent beasts like eyeless dolphins play in your wake.~18|A row of watchful zee-bats perch on the ship's railing. Their heads swivel in unison as you cross the deck.~0|That's all for now.~72|A row of watchful zee-bats hang from a cable. Their heads swivel in unison as you cross the deck.~9|A rock breaks the water like a surfacing zee-beast. No, it's a  zee-beast! No, it's a rock.~3|On the Surface, the sun still warms the Earth. Or so one assumes.~5|A brisk spatter of spray. The Unterzee is restless.~7|An electric shiver to the air. Storm is watching, the zailors would say.~22|The waves are cluttered with zee-wrack, like drowned hair drifting.~51|You are being watched.~52|A soft wind from the East. The impossible scent of pine.~53|Waves slap the side of the ship. Far below, something moves.~54|A ship's horn, far away.~55|Blue lightnings crawl leisurely up the funnel. "St Erasmus dancing!" the cry goes up.
Name: Something Awaits You

Description: On first sight, it looks like a tomb-colonist coffin. On closer examination, it carries stencilling reading SOOTHE & COOPER and a handwritten tag: 'DELIVERY TO DEPOT (A), STATION III'.
Name: Soothe & Cooper Long-Box

Description: Speculative Consonance: less than a technique, more than just a theory. [The Consonator does not limit your ability to hide.]
Name: Speculative Consonator

Description: The Unmakers have smashed these sad and rubbly remnants off the flanks of a Salt Lion. A contact in London will purchase them.
Name: Sphinxstone

Description: "AN INESCAPABLE ENDING!" A potent weapon which permits Flensing attacks.
Name: Stampshod's 'Calvary' Prong Launcher

Description: Did a Judgement hatch from this grim relic? Or was it something else entirely. Don't look too closely at the eye-hurting absence of colour.
Name: Star-Shell

Description: Your work for the Austere Acolyte has introduced you to others on the Island.
AvailableAt: The Trade in Long Boxes may lead you to meet new people.
Name: Station III: Acquainted with a Heartmetal Smith

Description: Your acquaintance with the Austere Acolyte.
Name: Station III: Earning the Acolyte's Favour

Description: An ingot of silvery metal, dreadfully cold to the touch.
Name: Station III: Heartmetal Ingot

Description: Involvement in a certain trade.
Name: Station III: Trading in Long Boxes

Description: A tool for pragmatic archeologists.
Name: Sticks of Dynamite

Description: It might be some sort of fish, but best not to look too closely.
Name: Strange Catch

Description: My. The Admiralty will certainly want to know this.
Name: Strategic Information

Description: The black bones of zee-monsters make for startling corsets.
Name: Stygian Ivory

Description: Tier 1 cargo ship for usage in trade routes.
Name: T1 Stymphalos-class Cargo

Description: It's very dangerous, but who cares when it's so pretty?
Name: Sunlight-Filled Mirrorcatch Box

Description: Food and equipment. [If you run out of supplies, Hunger will eventually destroy you.]
Name: Supplies

Description: Lenses, tinctures, candles, flammable oils. Now and then, bones.
Name: Supplies for the Work

Description: Ensures your ship's engine won't explode at Full Power.
Name: Suppression

Description: Who rules London's first Unterzee colony?
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You are working to protect London's interests in Port Carnelian~2|You have furthered the Khan's interests in port Carnelian~3|You are supporting the tigers' aboriginal claim to Port Carnelian~11|You have ensured Port Carnelian will remain squarely under her Majesty's control~12|You engineered the Khanate's annexation of Port Carnelian~13|You restored the native tigers to power in Port Carnelian
Name: Supremacy: Affairs in Port Carnelian

Description: God bless Her Enduring Majesty, the Empress.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Recovering~5|Renascent~7|Glorious~2|Promising~3|Significant~4|Substantial~6|Tremendous
Name: Supremacy: London

Description: LO THY DREAD EMPIRE CHAOS IS RESTORED LIGHT DIES BEFORE THY UNCREATING WORD
Name: Supremacy: The Anarchists

Description: UN. THE SUN. THE SUN. THE SUN. THE S
LevelDescriptionText: 5|Blazing~7|TRIUMPHANT~4|Burning~3|Radiant~1|Rising~6|Resplendent~2|Gleaming
Name: Supremacy: The Dawn Machine

Description: The Khanate's power is growing.
Name: Supremacy: The Khanate

Description: The nuns endure.
Name: Surveyed: Abbey Rock

Description: You've seen the blood that flows from the Continent's heart.
Name: Surveyed: Adam's Way

Description: You've seen where the sunlight brushes the zee.
Name: Surveyed: Aestival

Description: You have seen where the world ends. Behind those peaks of ice, something colder by far.
Name: Surveyed: Avid Horizon

Description: You have seen where the Service of the Well is performed.
Name: Surveyed: Chapel of Lights

Description: A caveful of exiles.
Name: Surveyed: Codex

Description: You have seen the place where they have more mushrooms than sense.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your visit to Demeaux Island has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office
Name: Surveyed: Demeaux Island

Description: You have returned from the land of soul-stealing monkeys.
Name: Surveyed: Empire of Hands

Description: You have met the squatters at the tower of zee ice.
Name: Surveyed: Frostfound

Description: You have seen the lights and the cliffs.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your visit to Gaider's Mourn has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office
Name: Surveyed: Gaider's Mourn

Description: You have seen the shattered citadel that lies in the zee.
Name: Surveyed: Godfall

Description: You've seen the house of the elect of the Dawn Machine.
Name: Surveyed: Grand Geode

Description: An odd place. Best to keep an eye on it.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your visit to Hunter's Keep has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office~1|Your visit to Hunter's Keep has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office
Name: Surveyed: Hunter's Keep

Description: You will return from Irem.
Name: Surveyed: Irem

Description: You have seen the Pirate-King's domain.
Name: Surveyed: Isle of Cats

Description: You've been to Khan's Heart, where the electric lights glow and the clans sharpen their claws.
Name: Surveyed: Khan's Heart

Description: You've seen where the Khanate rebels lair.
Name: Surveyed: Khan's Shadow

Description: You've seen the hungry place at the world's edge.
Name: Surveyed: Kingeater's Castle

Description: A detailed report on a place of interest. The Admiralty would value it.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your visit to Mt Palmerston has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office
Name: Surveyed: Mt Palmerston

Description: You've seen the Island of Lost Postmen.
Name: Surveyed: Nuncio

Description: You have seen first-hand the Rodent War.
Name: Surveyed: Pigmote Isle

Description: You have seen the city where the Clay Men are made for labour.
Name: Surveyed: Polythreme

Description: Information on Little London for Fallen London.
Name: Surveyed: Port Carnelian

Description: You have seen the place where chess is holy.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your visit to Port Cecil has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office
Name: Surveyed: Port Cecil

Description: You have seen the hill where the fire is kept.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your visit to Quaker's Haven has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office
Name: Surveyed: Quaker's Haven

Description: You survived a trip to the lair of the sorrow-spiders.
Name: Surveyed: Saviour's Rocks

Description: You can confirm, at least, that they are where they are.
Name: Surveyed: Shepherd Isles

Description: On the very edge of London's influence, curious matters are conducted.
Name: Surveyed: Station III

Description: You've seen the floating corpse of the Turtle.
Name: Surveyed: the Chelonate

Description: You've seen what grows around the Fathomking's throne.
Name: Surveyed: the Fathomking's Hold

Description: All foison, all abundance.
Name: Surveyed: the Mangrove College

Description: You've seen what happens when one digs too deep for secrets.
Name: Surveyed: the Salt Lions

Description: You've been to the Mother of Fungus.
Name: Surveyed: the Uttershroom

Description: There are dark machinations in the walled city of light.
Name: Surveyed: Varchas

Description: You have seen the place where the half-dead go.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your visit to Venderbight has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office
Name: Surveyed: Venderbight

Description: You have seen the isle where one face only is permitted.
Name: Surveyed: Visage

Description: You have seen the ice and salt.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Your visit to Whither has been confirmed by the Admiralty Records Office
Name: Surveyed: Whither

Description: Both secrets and prisoners are locked here.
Name: Surveyed: Wisdom

Description: Recall it, then light a candle. Light another.
Name: Tale of Terror!!

Description: The fear of the wide black zee, and the things beyond. [Reduce this with Shore Leave, especially in London. When you return to London after time at zee, your Terror will always drop to 50.]
LevelDescriptionText: 100|Crazed~25|Nervous~50|Fearful~75|Haunted~1|Wary~0|Serene
Name: Terror

Description: This barely qualifies as a book. Dozens of scraps of paper have been crammed into a scuffed folio. Each bears helpful advice on murder, and, often, a stain.
Name: The Boke of Sharpes

Description: You are far from home.
LevelDescriptionText: 0|Avernus~1|Naples~10|Vienna
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|Avernus: grey rock and blue water.~1|Naples: crowded streets and the sea's horizon~10|Vienna: revolution in the air
Name: The Cruelty of Sunlight

Description: This weird skull once adorned the worm-drawn priest-barge of the Chelonate.
Name: The Figurehead of the Eater of Names

Description: "These are the forces that drive the Bazaar." The Impeller runs very, very hot.
Name: The Fulgent Impeller

Description: You don't care for gods, real or imagined. You'll make your own way. [This does not protect you from the curses of the zee-gods.]
Name: The Gods of the Zee: Defiant

Description: It's watching you; if it even exists.
Name: The Gods of the Zee: Salt's Attention

Description: A curse lies on you: the curse of the nameless god of farewells.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Salt's curse lies on you
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Salt's curse lies on you
Name: The Gods of the Zee: Salt's Curse

Description: There are powers.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You know something of the three gods of the zee.
Name: The Gods of the Zee: Stone, Storm and Salt

Description: It's very far away; but perhaps it's watching you.
Name: The Gods of the Zee: Stone's Attention

Description: You carry a curse: the curse of the nameless god of home and healing.
Name: The Gods of the Zee: Stone's Curse

Description: An ancient anger knows you.
Name: The Gods of the Zee: Storm's Attention

Description: A curse lies on you: the curse of the nameless god of high places and anger.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Storm's curse lies on you
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|Storm's curse lies on you
Name: The Gods of the Zee: Storm's Curse

Description: The oldest and deadliest arachnid from its chitinous core. Deadliest, and now thankfully dead.
Name: The Heart of the Tree of Ages

Description: "Herein are recorded certain details of a Voyage through [xxxxx] in the company of [xxxxxx], on [xxxxxx]...." [Use this to increase your Pages. Unless you sell it, future captains will have access to it.]
Name: The Horizon Codex

Description: Now where exactly did you meet, again? Did Clathermont the tattooist introduce you?
Name: The Lady in Lilac

Description: Old soul. Where are you going, old soul?
Name: The Mark of the East

Description: This is the design he stored in Frostfound.
Name: The Mechanic's Secret

Description: She has no difficulties with blood. But she very much dislikes bloodstains.
Name: The Merciless Modiste

Description: It's not an attractive object. Perhaps you won't keep it on your mantelpiece.
Name: The Merciless Modiste's Heart

Description:
A book for children. One page is devoted to each of the colours of the Neath, which are not found on the Surface.

[Return to the Curator with each of the seven impossible colours in hand. The book's pages give you clues, but you'll need to seek far ports.]
Name: THE NEATHBOW

Description: Legend. Enigma. She has an appointment in Polythreme.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Art has been denied~10|The power of verse~20|Authority is restored~25|A duel has been won~30|The Modiste is triumphant
Name: The Pirate-Poet

Description: He has turned aside from his revenge.
Name: The Prudent Magician

Description: He has the quiet smile of a man who has tamped down the earth on his enemy's grave.
Name: The Satisfied Magician

Description: She was the youngest sister of the Hunter's Keep three. Now her home is gone. She will not show her face, nor speak of what occurred, but she is prepared to use her education to help heal your crew...
Name: The Scarred Sister

Description: The place which is no-place held you, crushed you. You carry the wounds still.
Name: The Scars of the North

Description: Sealed with a ribbon. It looks like a ribbon, anyway.
Name: The Scholar's Notes

Description: A shimmering complexus of steel and glass. In its heart, a serpent-king rages. Or so the Magician claims.
Name: The Serpentine

Description: The lights of the Elder Continent swim in your blood.
Name: The Touch of the South

Description: Something silver looks out through his eyes.
Name: The Urbane Magician

Description: You have seen behind the Dawn Machine
Name: The Western Stigma

Description: For this, they will all remember you.
Name: The Zong of the Zee

Description: The clock is ticking!
Name: Time Remaining...

Description: Does he ever sleep? His eyes are dark-circled, but his hands are steady.
AvailableAt: Sometimes available for hire in London, or in a distant port of the North.
Name: Tireless Mechanic

Description: Technically, passengers rather than goods. But you'd never know it to talk to them. [They'll pay their passage to the Tomb-Colonies: sell them there.]
Name: Tomb-Colonist

Description: In one of the most striking coincidences of our times, torpedoes are 'torpedo-shaped'. [Ammunition for Torpedo Salvoes.]
Name: Torpedo Components

Description: Deploy these in combat for unparalleled protection against torpedoes!
Name: Torpedo Nets

Description: Deployed protection against torpedoes, expressed as %
Name: Torpedo Protection

Description: This determines the effectiveness of torpedo devices. It's only available from device enhancements.
Name: Torpedo Tubes

Description: Each one from a different mouth. [A previous captain in your lineage was a debased cannibal who served the Chapel of Lights and the Drowned Man]
Name: Trophy: A Collection of Teeth

Description: The image of an imposing memorial. The rain-blurred name is difficult to read. [A previous captain in your lineage found and buried their father's bones - or a substitute.]
Name: Trophy: A Daguerreotype of a Memorial

Description: The resemblance is obvious. Both are smiling. [A previous captain in your lineage found and rescued their father.]
Name: Trophy: A Family Portrait

Description: An unusual flag from a tiny nation far across the zee.
Name: Trophy: A Folded Flag

Description: The Postmaster Cryptic herself signed this letter. [A previous captain in your lineage found bones in a misaddressed package.]
Name: Trophy: A Letter of Commendation

Description: A zee-monster paperweight, beautifully carved from Stygian ivory. [A previous captain in your lineage proved to be the child of a zee-monster]
Name: Trophy: A Model Monster

Description: The Zociety of Zeafarers took up a collection to have this struck. [A previous captain in your lineage found that their father had sacrificed himself to save his crew.]
Name: Trophy: A Posthumous Medal

Description: The fragments are proudly displayed on a lacquered plaque. [A previous captain in your lineage found bones at Kingeater's Castle]
Name: Trophy: A Shattered Coral Knife

Description: It's a first edition, too. [A captain of your lineage wrote the definitive work of maritime literature.]
Name: Trophy: An Autographed Copy of the Zong of the Zee

Description: Tucked into a desk drawer is a restaurant bill with a triple-circled final total larger than the cost of most ships. [A captain of your lineage won riches and a comfortable retirement.]
Name: Trophy: An Impossible Restaurant Bill

Description: Was this once someone? [A previous captain in your lineage discovered they were part zee-monster, and abandoned their human existence.
Name: Trophy: Not Quite Human

Description: A painting hangs in your study, of a wrought-iron buoy, endlessly afloat, light piercing in the Neath's dark. You can almost hear the bell. [A captain of your lineage sailed east out of the world.]
Name: Trophy: Restless

Description: A painting hangs in your study. Two travellers watch, forever, as the lights of their destination come closer. [A captain of your lineage sailed east out of the world.]
Name: Trophy: the Lights of London

Description: A painting hangs in your study, of mist on the face of impossible mountains. [A captain of your lineage sailed east out of the world.]
Name: Trophy: Those Final Mountains

Description: They make these on the roof-tops, and won't say why. [A one-use item that will remove all Illumination from both sides in combat, and increase Terror.]
Name: Unclear Device

Description: What awaits the Deviless, in the Brass Embassy?
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Hell will welcome the Deviless~2|Hell believes the Deviless is a traitor
Name: Uncovering Mysteries: An Infernal Fate

Description: Depths are there for the plumbing. What did the Starved Men leave?
Name: Uncovering Mysteries: the Shattered Citadel

Description: Safer not to, eh?
Name: Unread Log

Description: He's always watching. He doesn't blink.
Name: Unsettling Sage

Description: A crate of exceptional human souls. It has never known the tender touch of the Imperial Customs stamp. Consequently, it cannot be sold on the open market, and you'd better not be caught with it.
Name: Unstamped Crate of Brilliant Souls

Description: A crate of pleading souls. This one does not bear a customs stamp - it is contraband!
Name: Unstamped Crate of Human Souls

Description: A fruit, a jewel, a tear? Leave that distinction to the botanists. It tastes a little like pine-nuts.
Name: Uttershroom Sporule

Description: You know your way to the Hospital, the Guard-House and Mihir's temple.
Name: Varchas: Directions from the Varchaasi Guard

Description: It's a good thing. Probably?
Name: Varchas: the Agnihotri's Interest

Description: It is hard-earned.
Name: Varchas: The Dour-Faced Nurse's Approval

Description: It seems innocuous enough; what's the worst that could happen?
Name: Varchas: The Jewel-Turbaned Youth's Invitation

Description: Varchas has five mirrored towers. When each has sounded its bell, it is evening.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The first Tower-bell has sounded.~2|The second Tower-bell has sounded.~3|The third Tower-bell has sounded.~4|The fourth Tower-bell has sounded.~5|The fifth Tower-bell has sounded: it is evening.~6|It is night, although there is no darkness in Varchas. Time to sleep.~7|Your permitted time in Varchas is over. Time to go; until next time.
Name: Varchas: The Knells of the Towers

Description: They worship the sun in Varchas, and have banished darkness from the city.
Name: Varchas: the Mirrored City

Description: Won in bruises and sweat
Name: Varchas: the Respect of the Guard

Description: The brother of the Keeper of the Western Principal Mirror; has a weakness for wine and dark-eyed boys.
Name: Varchas: the Tardy Lamp-Lighter

Description: Speed, stealth, deception. Decreases the range at which enemies will spot you.
Name: Veils

Description: Black, and inscribed with curling symbols.
Name: Venturer's Medallion

Description: Ten marked vials packed in a carefully padded casket. [This stuff is too dangerous even to be properly illegal. Be cautious in taking it to London.]
LevelDescriptionText: 1|Smuggling a proscribed cargo of red honey
Name: Vials of Red Honey

Description: Set it on your binnacle,  feed it the blood of zee-bats. It will guide you.
Name: Vigilant Idol

Description: A knowledge of roles and how they are to be played. [Sometimes, ignorance is freedom. Learning more will have complex effects.]
LevelDescriptionText: 3|Aware of Visitor Roles~4|Aware of Moth Role~7|Aware of Higher Roles
Name: Visage: Expertise in Parts

Description: Taking light into the dark places.
LevelDescriptionText: 2|Empty-handed~3|Carrying a flare and nervous~4|Empty-handed and nervous~5|Carrying a flare and brave~6|Empty-handed and brave~10|Violator of the Sacred Mysteries~1|Carrying a flare~9|Respecter of the Sacred Mysteries~11|Respectful Scholar of the Mysteries~12|Impertinent Scholar of the Mysteries
Name: Visage: Ritual Participant

Description: The role assigned on the island of Visage.
LevelDescriptionText: 0|Unmasked~1|Bat Mask~2|Frog Mask~3|Locust Mask~4|Moth Mask~5|Mask of the Risen Sun
Name: Visage: your Mask

Description: Far above, the Sun remains. [In Venderbight, they're always eager for news of the Surface.]
Name: Vision of the Surface

Description: Vitality and intelligence. What would we do without them? Especially if we're spies, diplomats, or pirates.
Name: Vital Intelligence

Description: Its eyes glitter with awareness. Its melancholy has dissipated: now you sense anticipation.
Name: Wakeful Idol

Description: A sinister little squatting image... but its eyes are pleading.
Name: Watchful Curio

Description: WE WILL WORK. WE WILL ONLY WORK. [This trio of Clay stokers will reduce crew requirements, but also crew capacity, and will slightly increase engine power. They are fitted to an Auxiliary slot. When they are not in use, they will stand, patiently, hands by their sides, flat grey eyes unreadable. One will say, sometimes: "I LIKE IT WHEN IT IS QUIET."]
Name: WE ARE CLAY

Description: Blood oozes slowly from the flesh around it, and is drawn into the scar.
Name: Weeping Scar

Description: "Oh yes, the Drowned Man is humming tonight, a song in the water like the bones of fish."
Name: Whispering Trophy-Case

Description: Speak the right phrase, and the tumblers will align and unlock it. But what is the right phrase? [The Alarming Scholar may have some ideas.]
Name: Whisper-Locked Puzzle-Box

Description: Glass as clear as ice and sharp as salt.
Name: Whithern Optical

Description: She knows the uses of fire. But she's not cut out for the zee. Take her to London, and the Brass Embassy.
Name: Wistful Deviless

Description: "...tomb-colonists do not exactly die. Many end in the Grand Sanatorium, withering slowly to insensate horror. (This is not publicised.) A few end in Emergence: transformation to a flimsy thing of wings and knowledge, an end in ecstacy, the delight of becoming an egg, of sorts. This is accounted a grand and vile and tempting sin..."
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You witnessed the Curator's Emergence
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You witnessed the Curator's Emergence
Name: Witnessed: the Curator's End

Description: You have told a truth that cuts deep.
Name: Wounding Truth

Description: Its perpetual ill temper does not endear it to the crew, but it does make it an effective ratter.
AvailableAt: Sometimes lurking on the docks of London.
Name: Wretched Mog

Description: A melancholy old rogue with a difficult debt. Take him home. [Be sure you have at least six thousand Echoes in cash when you do.]
Name: Your Father

Description: One set of bones looks much like another, but you know whose these really are.
Name: Your Father's Bones

Description: What next in the quest for your father's bones?
LevelDescriptionText: 100|Visit the Fathomking~4|Speak with the Dark-Spectacled Admiral at the Admiralty~200|Fulfil the Fathomking's Requests~54|Seek Kingeater's Castle, in the far south-east~53|Seek a parcel with your name in Nuncio, somewhere in the south of the zee~56|Seek Visage, somewhere in the south of the zee~52|Seek the Bone Men in the Chelonate, in the east of the zee~300|Fathomking's Requests Fulfilled~55|Seek Horizon's Aspect, in the North~400|A Message for the Chapel of Lights~3|Bring a Zee-Ztory, a Memory of Distant Shores and a Tale of Terror to Huffam, in London~5|Bring two sacks of Darkdrop Coffee from the South for the  Bishop of St Fiacre, in London~2|Bring Mutersalt from the North to Slivvy, in London~6|Bring Scintillack, from Port Cecil or elsewhere, to the Gracious Widow in London
ChangeDescriptionText: 4|Speak with the Dark-Spectacled Admiral at the Admiralty~5|Bring two sacks of Darkdrop Coffee from the South for the Bishop of St Fiacre, in London~6|Bring Scintillack, from Port Cecil or elsewhere, to the Gracious Widow in London~53|Seek a parcel with your name in Nuncio, somewhere in the south of the zee~54|Seek Kingeater's Castle, in the far south-east~55|Seek Horizon's Aspect, in the North~56|Seek Visage, somewhere in the south of the zee~100|Visit the Fathomking~200|Fulfil the Fathomking's Requests~300|You have fulfilled the Fathomking's Requests~400|You have a Message for the Chapel of Lights~500|Bring your father back to London~2|Bring Mutersalt from the North to Slivvy, in London. [You can buy Mutersalt at Whither if you have a little money.]~3|Bring a Zee-Ztory, a Memory of Distant Shores and a Tale of Terror to Huffam, in London. [Explore to find these things.]~52|Seek the Bone Men in the Chelonate, in the east of the zee
Name: Your Father's Bones: A Cold Trail

Description: The heart of one of the great monsters: Mt Nomad or the Tree of Ages, perhaps.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The Fathomking has requested a Legend's Heart~0|You have fulfilled the Fathomking's request for a Legend's Heart
Name: Your Father's Bones: a Legend's Heart for the Fathomking

Description: Bring an engine or weapon of unique brilliance. Your Officers can help.
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|You have fulfilled the Fathomking's request for a Miracle of Science~1|The Fathomking has requested a Miracle of Science
Name: Your Father's Bones: a Miracle of Science for the Fathomking

Description: Bring the Fathomking sunlight... or something which will pass for sunlight.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The Fathomking has requested a Sky-Light~0|You have fulfilled the Fathomking's request for a Sky-Light
Name: Your Father's Bones: a Sky-Light for the Fathomking

Description: Bring an Officer to the Fathomking. Choose someone who has finished their business on the zee, and might be willing to stay in the King's court. Probably someone who likes fish.
ChangeDescriptionText: 0|You have fulfilled the Fathomking's request for a Willing Guest~1|The Fathomking has requested a Willing Guest
Name: Your Father's Bones: a Willing Guest for the Fathomking

Description: The Fathomking wishes you to witness the death of something that is the oldest of its kind, and return.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The Fathomking has requested an account of an Eldest's End~0|You have fulfilled the Fathomking's request for an account of an Eldest's End
Name: Your Father's Bones: an Eldest's End for the Fathomking

Description: Find the fruit of a tree which will not die.
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|The Fathomking has requested the Fruit of an Eternal Tree~0|You have fulfilled the Fathomking's request for the Fruit of an Eternal Tree
Name: Your Father's Bones: Fruit of the Eternal Tree for the Fathomking

Description: The Fathomking has given you what you need. Take it to your destination.
LevelDescriptionText: 2|A Stolen Bone for the Chelonites~6|The Name of a Mask~7|A Message for the Chapel of Lights~3|A Delivery Address for Nuncio~4|A coral-bladed knife matching one in Kingeater's Castle~5|The Location of a Stone Fragment from Avid Horizon
ChangeDescriptionText: 2|You have a stolen bone to return to the Chelonate.~3|You have the delivery address for Nuncio~6|You have a slip of paper with the name of a mask from VIsage~4|You have a knife to match with the one at Kingeater's Castle~5|The Location of a Stone Fragment from Avid Horizon
Name: Your Father's Bones: The Fathomking's Key

Description: Strange truths are told of the waves and what lies beneath. The lies are even stranger.
Name: Zee-ztory

Description: The colour: old blood on snow. The taste: paprika, mushrooms, irony. The recipe: closely guarded.
Name: Zzoup

Description: Just how many doors does Prisoner's Honey open? This may unlock additional starting options in Zero Summer (see the bar above) and other StoryNexus worlds...
AvailableAt: Sample Prisoner's Honey in Veilgarden
Name: A Glimpse of Worlds through Honeyed Glass

Description: Something very special from the Red Eminence
Name: Cabinet Noir: Carte Blanche

Description: All's well that ends well. Gleam is gained from relatively happy endings.
Name: Endings: Gleam

Description: More bitter than sweet. Gloom is gained from relatively grim endings.
Name: Endings: Gloom

Description: Took a Master of the Bazaar captive!
Name: Silver Tree: The Diplomat

Description: Descended with Karakorum at its Fall
Name: Silver Tree: The Echo

Description: became an adviser to a great ruler of the East
Name: Silver Tree: The King of Kings

Description: Escaped the Theft of Karakorum
Name: Silver Tree: The Road

Description: Failbetter has awarded this user Accredited Architect status
Name: StoryNexus: the Worldsmith

Description: Explore an ocean. Smuggle silk and souls. Devour your crew.
Name: Sunless Sea

Description: Don't open it.
Name: Sunless Sea: A Soothe & Cooper Long-Box

Description: It awaits the phrase that will open it.
Name: Sunless Sea: A Whisper-Locked Puzzle-Box

Description: Listen.
Name: Sunless Sea: Advice for the Navigator

Description: A renegade Clay Woman roams the zee, pillaging the ships of weaker captains.
LevelDescriptionText: 1|You have unlocked the Pirate-Poet in Sunless Sea!
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You have unlocked the Pirate-Poet in Sunless Sea!
Name: Sunless Sea: DLC Pirate-Poet

Description: An orphaned organ, once piloted by an organ orphan.
Name: Sunless Sea: DLC The Cladery Heart

Description: You have unlocked the Parabolan Panther mascot in Sunless Sea!
ChangeDescriptionText: 1|You can now acquire the Parabolan Panther mascot in Sunless Sea.
Name: Sunless Sea: Feasting With Panthers

Description: Play Sunless Sea to receive a Parabolan Kitten.
Name: Sunless Sea: Supping with Kittens

Description: Thwarted the Bazaar when it tried to take Karakorum
Name: The Silver Tree: Pride

Description: Gained immortality when Karakorum fell
Name: The Silver Tree: The Herald

Description: You freed Iria - by unbinding the ironbird from winter...
Name: Winterstrike: The Crescent Moon

Description: You used the ironbird's energies to change Iria forever, breaking the power of the Scarf and Feather Society
Name: Winterstrike: The Death of Art

Description: You used the ironbird's energies to change Iria forever, breaking the power of the Ocular Guard
Name: Winterstrike: The Eater of Guards

Description: You freed Iria - by utterly destroying the ironbird
Name: Winterstrike: The Ferocity of Roses

Description: You freed Iria - by killing the ironbird, but mercifully
Name: Winterstrike: The Lullaby

Description: You used the ironbird's energies to change Iria forever, breaking the power of the Circle of Bullets
Name: Winterstrike: The Miracle of Spores

Description: You joined yourself to the ironbird, to carry winter to city after city
Name: Winterstrike: The Prophet
